fwRe0qdtxk6WjQpbd0VG_w.text: This place is great! I love how you can pick which type of tempura you want. The fish cake tempura was my favorite.   You can also try some items in a "mini version". My husband and I split an udon bowl with kakiage, sweet potato, asparagus, and fish cake tempura. We both left with a happy tummy. I highly recommend this place.   -only thing is that tempura can be served warm (not hot like I'm used to), but the tempura sauce is hot enough.

v9lmALOPBUKwNAvlPQ48lQ.text: I don't normally drink soup broth, but theirs is really good !. I got their number 2 nabeyaki udon, when it came out was really big and not what I expected. You can split this between you and your date. It's not your typical sit down and a waiter comes, you go in line to place your order and you have a selection from their fried dishes. The atmosphere is dope, classic Japanese style ambience. I'd come back here again, came during lunch rush but they were still quick and efficient .

BJGTW3V5TSQqXoN4WryWag.text: Definitely a plus for me very affordable great selection. This place is very spacious and clean customer service is on point.

N5zFahaPV23pMbXrIp-v4Q.text: Food was alright however the service was very unorganized, the gyoza that we order took 30 mins to make even though they told us it would be done in 15 mins. I wouldn't come back again.

lSSMps1GihsRk-sC8Y7MJw.text: A nice clean inexpensive place to get some yummy noodles!   They also have smaller finger foods and dishes with rice.   I was quite impressed to have found this place, I totally recommend it.   Great for families too.

pvaUgOO9yhOhVaLkg5RgpA.text: If you are ever craving some noodles and/or tempura, this is the place to be.  I came here twice for dinner during my Vegas visit and I miss it to this day.  You order the type of noodles you want and then you can pick out the different types of tempura you want (whole egg, squid, shrimp, assorted veggies, etc).  The food is very affordable (but if you cannot resist adding a ton of tempura to your meal, like me, the prices do add up ).  I had the Kitsune Udon (dashi broth with tofu) both times. My favorite tempura is the whole egg (with runny center) and asparagus.  I also tried the salmon rice balls which were good but I felt like they could have been more generous with the filling.  All in all, a delicious lunch or dinner!  PS Don't forget to check in on Yelp for 10% off or a free drink!

SQai5h-tGqbKq4Rm1pfdcA.text: Love the cafeteria style udon.  Reminds me of Japan.  This is customized your own udon kinda places but of course they have their own special dishes you can order from.  Food was delicious!

0OtBg9u_nYUdIZjn8TyWIA.text: I was in Las Vegas for a week and there are a TON of restaurants here and we decided to try this out.  Pros: - Spacious with plenty of seating - LOVE the interior - A variety of udons to choose from and some other things as well - Friendly and nice workers - I love their drink selection because it's not a typical soda fountain - I see a lot of ramen places, but I rarely see a place that does specifically udon and I love udon - I like how you order up front and get your food after. It makes it seem like a more chill place to hang out vs getting seated first, order, etc etc. I tend to like places where you can order first and is self serve  Cons: - I got the spicy udon, but I felt like it was too salty for me. If they decreased on the saltiness than it would be perfect  Overall, I was craving udon one day and glad I found this place! We went one night for dinner and came back the next day for another round :D We came back the 2nd time during Halloween and one of the workers went around passing everyone candy! That is so sweet to me. I may be back in LV next year, so I'll be looking forward to coming back

PDauUOYcXJZbe_DsordoBA.text: I was blasted on Facebook with advertisements and why not check it out.  Tou pick up a tray and go through the line like a cafeteria and order then it is made to order.  The appetizers are readily available and finally you rang right up and walk to the dining area.  It  was packed.  I told the staff that the tea was out and i waited, tired of waiting and finished my main course and finally the tea was made.  Food was okay, service from the bussers was good, but to wait for the tea was long. After you are done with the meal there are grey bins to place the dishes

f4Y-hyCgP1styiL6OHDqTA.text: Food was delicious. I had a number one (my favorite that I ate everywhere in Japan) and it was on point. I liked that I could do whatever toppings I wanted so I got exactly what I wanted. My husband got a number 10 and ate almost every bite. Only thing I would mention is to go early- most of the sides like rice balls and gyoza are all made at the beginning of the shift so they run out quickly and do not replenish. Otherwise, gets a  from us.

S2KQuForPWo8eibN6N9R0Q.text: Heard a lot of good things about this place and the family wanted to try it out for the first time. Ambiance is nice and guy that seems like the manager informed us how it worked and asked if it was our first time, very good customer service. A younger guy takes all our orders and no one else is behind us in line. I gave my order and told him no green onions specifically and he said ok. My cousin orders the same thing so I told him again on mines, no green onions on mine because im allergic . He looks at me and says ok. Order comes and they messed up so they go ahead and make a new one but forget to actually make it. Whole family is almost done eating and thats when they realize they havent made it yet. Told them to cancel and walked out. Younger dude couldnt get a simple request and couldnt fess that he messed up.  Thanks bro.

HOxVbhWp7AyDsPjZ8YhCcg.text: Great place to get authentic udon soup on a cold day. Love this place it's awesome so many choices

OEREnQWa-jovDGtUBkjI9Q.text: Yummy! Love the fast cafeteria style ordering! A little light on the protein toppings. Could be since I'm here on grand opening read free meal! Yes!  The #11 seafood tomato cream is good, heavy garlic and decent amount of seafood. The mini beef bowl has minimal amount of beef. Not so good. Tempura had lots of choices. Loved the higher quality bendy states! Most restaurants don't have bendy staws! They have coke products

6iSukxGvkQjPfA-jArwIng.text: Highly recommended. The Nabeyaki Udon was absolutely delicious! Udon is freshly made to order. I can't  rave enough on the flavors of the broth. Full of flavor that's delightfully satisfying and tasty to the palate.

B_oeeZowO9AQGXu3cfgmdg.text: Great place! The food was great and the service was excellent. Specially around the holiday season, services are not as good as used to be at every restaurant but not here.

5n4aL8IPY11wlgvZ_h4IPQ.text: Recommended by a co worker and was not disappointed. Broth was tasty  and noodles were perfectly done. Also ordered the garlic miso pork belly to share, and only complaint is wish we had more!!

aEmbw82LujhXq1ohPrChpw.text: An interesting and different eating establishment, with a few cafeteria similarities. The menu has quite a few options and the dishes were udon and non udon. As you circle around a choose your entree by #, there are some add ones you can load on your tray, on the way to see the cashier. The drinks were everything from hot/ cold teas, lemonade and a dispenser of all kinds of sodas. The food was good and pretty tasty, the seating area was much like a lunch room.

Tl5SnjdZ9-ivonW_m2Gxyw.text: Ate here with family. It's affordable and food is great! I tried the best seller item they have in their menu, which is the seafood cream tomato. Flavor is amazing and it was very filling. Used Yelp to check in for a free drink. I definitely come back again one of these days! Do recommend eating here.

dwgdj1OjRpdLN-FhX-q4AQ.text: As someone who has had Marukame Udon from Hawaii, I was hoping this would help the cravings. At first glance, it's a pretty restaurant with nice decorations and convincing looking pictures. The workers get a pass because it was slow and they were probably bored. Just having everyone say welcome and look at you at the same time is off-putting. The Kitsune Udon was alright and it was honestly the only reason this even got a 2nd star. If you take a look below at the pictures; the sauce cup for one of the Udon bowls have a completely solidified/fossilized noodle? Onion? Squid? Either way, it was so hard the wooden chopstick I used to pry at it broke. I hope it's just part of the cup as design. The chicken was pretty warm but doesn't seem fresh at all. I was assuming it would be a bit hotter because it's under a light but maybe the light doesn't do anything. Also it was a bit pink... But probably the biggest thing is the water. I don't know what happened here but the water smelled so bad. It smelled like fish has been sitting in it for days. The worst part is when I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and mouth, the water smelled the same. Overall, fixes should be made and this place will definitely be better.

NstB73TCzi3fA56Lyhdoqw.text: A new way to taste authentic Japanese food in an economic price. Basically it's a self serve Japanese restaurant where you order your food and drink at the counter, get ur number and wait to be called.   Lots of choices and the price is reasonable.   Highly suggest buying a cup to try out their Calpico or ice tea in a hot day. We checked from yelp and receive one for free of charge.  Also when you are ordering ramen make sure to add 2.50 for a mini rice bowl if you are first time coming to this place.   Onigiri is ok.  Must have: ramen since they are fresh made every day. Suggested: pork belly rice bowl, shrimp tempura, steam pork belly bun/Bao, Calpico.   My only disappointment is that couldn't get a try of their taiyaki since the machine was broken.

XgMGHG6LP_vBKaWfZGLHpw.text: Bomb dot come will be returning, fast service and everyone very nice, tomorrow moms birthday this my be the place.

cSJ9Io4MXeKF0gr4djtPCQ.text: This place is fantastic. Good food, affordable, and a free drink when you check in with yelp. No complaints here.

GNZ2wNGMb2L4LtDEsthEsw.text: I went here on the 9th & I am so glad we did. The cashier, I believe her name was kailyn was very welcoming. As soon as we walked in, all the employees greeted us. Kailyn went out of her way to ask us if we are first time customers, and walked us through the menu. My husband had the chicken katsu and I had the bun. Both meals were amazing, and portions are large esp for the great price. The food was all nice and freshly made. The workers came around more than once to ask if our meal was okay !  Also Chris, noticed my husbands skyline and saw we were newlyweds & gave us a promo meal for our next visit.  That was very nice of him & all of your staff.  Also, another plus, they do military discount. The decor was also very cute. I cant wait to come back to try more of their delish meals

M5WC_Zn_Wm6n5Xyb8EygHg.text: Exemplary pre-grand opening!  Everyone was on point and personable.  Light, refreshing clam udon and a mini beef rice bowl that reminded me of my favorite home cooked bulgogi with generous but not overpowering sauce...  Definitely a keeper ^__^  shrimp and pumpkin tempura were delicious and crisp as well.  Thank you all~

REtAtlkKqaC8Ko2IZ22E-w.text: Oooooh the UDON so freaking good! My only complaint is that I took my time eating it so it cooled off midway through my meal. The tempura is crispy, crunchy, and yum yum. They left you add a mini bowl for $2.50 of your choice and please treat yourself by ordering the garlic miso pork belly. That shiz delish. As for drinks, they have a Freestyle Coke machine, but what you really want is their LEMONADE. I used to work at Hot Dog on a Stick and this lemonade is my #2 right after Hot Dog on a Stick's lime lemonade. Will definitely be back!

jM-dTeiyfZtNeRCG-exjwA.text: Food was tasty and affordable. It just felt like something was missing for this noodle house to get a 5 star. I wish they would offer the miso soup as part of the meal and improve its taste to be more traditional. Other than that, this place is unique!

uhqfKqPxO96TH5AeAO626Q.text: Omg I love udon noodles and I am in love with this place. The staff is friendly and helpful with selections. You can get double noodles! Atmosphere is clean and cool vibe.

jrhx4Uvzh5WI2IZU05ns1w.text: the place is clean and nice. the waiters and helper are friendly and helpful. love the variety of drinks in their drink bar. They even have japanese yogurt drink for all you can drink that a plus.  the udon texture is good and pork bun was wonderful. definitely coming back again to try other dishes

PTL2Nqj24XCYdmneY4nnJQ.text: This place has such a nice aura as soon as you walk in. Parking can be hard to find sometimes as it's on the corner of a plaza. They're only open for several hours a day, around dinner time. Don't let this deter you from coming though. You won't have a problem getting through the line (cafeteria style) and finding a seat. I would give this place 5 stars but I had a indifferent experience my first time. The reason being was that although I had a buzzer, I acquired all three of my dishes at different times and in different fashion. When it first buzzed, I went up and got my first dish. 10 minutes passed and then finally the second dish was brought out to us.Another 5 min passed and I finally had to go up again. I had wished they stuck to one format and are more consistent. Otherwise some dishes are a hit or miss. The pork belly bao and nabeyaki are my favorite though. It doesn't hurt to give this place a shot. Let me know what you think

DOGNM21kr8UybniNo2O8bg.text: I can make this at home and will come out better with frozen udon noodle. That's my first thought after my first few bites. The texture of udon noodle was not what I was expecting from high reviewed reataurant. Tempuras were not fresh. No flavor at all from the ingredients. Kabocha tempura cannot go wrong usually but this was way too thin and the flavor wasn't right... Age in kitsune udon had no flavor either. Simply not good enough for the high reviews they receive on Yelp.. .I'm very confused. The price should be cheaper for this quality too. Staff here is friendly though. Therefore, 2 stars. I regret for spending $25 at this restaurant for lunch.

Fffet9NS1SjepHNqeJPrEA.text: Very yummy udon / rice dishes with many different options. Very friendly staffs. The lemonade is very good, and I love their dessert, too. Great place, highly recommended.

naS-8PYtjajfShlFEAj6zQ.text: It's just ok.  Service people are a little goofy.  Having too much fun and need to keep it more about the work the day I was there.   No other customers so I guess they were bored.  No gyoza yet it's on the menu.  The grab n go is nice but with no customers it's hard to keep stuff out there I guess

ZqXJejuF26YZG0o2MCTNSA.text: To start, the restaurant is like a cafeteria setup. You take a tray, order, get your food, and pay. So it's a good spot definitely for a quick lunch. The staff were all nice, so that's a plus. I ordered the kike udon and curry katsu. In all honesty, I think they got their playing wrong. The curry katsu came in a bowl that's bigger than my sink, it was like obnoxiously huge lol. The udon, I know they make the noodles on site, but honestly, it's not as good as the prepackaged ones. The noodles don't have the texture and the feel of udon noodles that I like. The food overall wasn't really that good to me. So overall, this restaurant is a solid 3 star. I'll probably visit once in a while, but it's definitely not in my top10

3Bv7cz66OQlzPvLbedaUeg.text: Truly the flavor of what was expected by all reviews. The Is on tender and smooth with great flavor, tempura has a texture to the bite that is amazing, but the main component to everything is the customer service. Being a manager in food and beverage, I really appreciate when people go above and beyond with service. Shows how people. Truly love their job and like people. Hope this business gets many recognitions. Keep it up team

LhiVv7iNVVQfvyM35WTnLQ.text: So, so, so happy to have tried this gem! Authentic, freshly made, perfectly cooked udon noodles in piping hot, unctuous, umami broth. The tempura, although sitting under a warming lamp, was set out in small portions so it was all fresh and crispy. I also have to sing praises of the staff. While everyone was spectacular, i was blown away by Jasmine. She greeted us at the door (must've caught the clueless look on our faces!), walked us through the process, checked on us several times to make sure we were doing okay, and helped carry our food to our table since we were wrangling a toddler and all the accompanying STUFF that comes along with a kid. Definitely can't wait to go back for dinner in a few days!

gprmOhYzvK2JoTNKDCto9Q.text: One of my favourite places in Vegas. Every single staff is friendly and the food is just amazing. I really really love that you can get unlimited refill of Calpico. A True childhood dream come True. I have some suggestions to make this place even better, so I hope the manager will see this. It'd be really awesome if they don't use disposable chopsticks and add at least some recycling bins, compost bins would be extra awesome. Cafe Sanuki is probably my most recommended and most visited Japanese restaurant. So it'd be cool to see more environmentally friendly changes.

7R0IuOEKFcPbMww13gkErQ.text: Soooooooooooooooooo good!!!! Everyone should come and try these food!!!! I'm so amazed by how yum the food was!

3gzC8y56VDol05Pc4W4ZFQ.text: All I can say is that the yakiudon was gross and not authentic at all.  The tempura looked like its been sitting there for hours and didn't taste good either.  Tried to get salmon onigiri and Oden also but both was unavailable.  My daughter love the Zaru udon though.

usLH2X-O4WAwRTMb62bEVA.text: My daughter & I love Cafe Sanuki! :) It reminds us of Marukame Udon in Hawaii. When we moved to Vegas from Hawaii, Marukame Udon was one of the food places we missed. So we were beyond excited when we learned Cafe Sanuki opened here in Vegas. And happy to say we were not disappointed.   Items tried & liked (so far):  Curry Udon Kake Udon Kisune Udon Zaru Udon Shrimp Tempura Asparagus Tempura Sweet Potato Tempura Kabocha Tempura Zucchini Tempura Squid Tempura Fish Cake Tempura Kakiage Inari Taiyaki Cafe Sanuki Lemonade  Calpico Yogurt Drink (try it with a squirt or two of mango syrup)   Noodles are cooked perfectly and broths are tasty & hot.   In my opinion, the onigiri could use a little more seasoning.  I tried the spam (1st visit) & tuna mayo (7th visit) and both were a little bland.  It's great if you dip it into the tempura sauce.   Restaurant is spacious & clean. Staff are always friendly & helpful :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kake Udon, Asparagus Tempura &amp; Tuna Mayo Onigiri :)
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Udon, Asparagus Tempura &amp; Spam Onigiri :)

fwcgvCmXWSN2JbQ8U0AI1A.text: On a cold day, what's better than a nice hot bowl of udon?! I came here for lunch on a weekday. As you enter the restaurant, they have a display case of all the menu items, so you can see what you want to order. Walk around the corner and they have a menu you can look at as well. There are trays stack up and you grab a tray and place your order. It's a bit confusing at first because I didn't know if i was supposed to wait for my noodles..no one told me anything. But within a min, they gave me my bowl of udon noodles after placing the order. There are also tempuras and chicken, where you can grab what you want. The prices for tempura range about $1.75 per piece. After you grab whatever tempura you want, you pay and then eat! The style is set up somewhat like a fast food style.  My order: Kake udon. The most simple of them all. Broth was good, hot, and refreshing. The udon noodles were cooked to perfection. Chewy texture, not overcooked or undercooked.  Shrimp tempura: i only grabbed one piece. The size of the shrimp tempura was pretty small for  the price. It was also cold as well. It was not good.   Chicken. This was the first thing i took a bite of as soon as i sat down with my food. And unfortunately this was cold as well. They give you 2 pieces of chicken on a skewer, which would have been decent if it was hot.   Drinks: they have calpico and sanuki lemonade!  Sanuki lemonade taste like a mix of calpico and lemonade together. It was pretty bomb! They also have syrups you can flavor your drinks as well. But I highly recommend the sanuki lemonade!   Overall it was a good udon place minus the tempura.They need to do something about the food warming for the tempuras,  because obviously what they have is not keeping the food up to the correct temperatures per standards. But udon is definitely worth the try!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kake udon with shrimp tempura and chicken. Shrimp tempura was so tiny and cold! Chicken was cold as well!
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Display case of menu items as soon as you walk thru the door

43OgVOnRDeDj4Arvmn3HqA.text: Awesome food and super helpful staff! There are 8 of us and we are all really enjoying our udon soups, bao & rice bowls (the pork belly is fantastic!). I'll eat here again when I'm in Vegas.

xmRpy4MoSHMZy1I55McqmA.text: You know this is spot is legit when you see Japanese moms eat here and enjoy it. Definitely a great spot to get some quick and yummy food. The nabeyaki udon was spot on!

MG3zW8SftJiA-hfqGaPMXA.text: Udonnnnnnnnn me and udon you!!!   Who would've thought you'd find this kinda cafe in Vegas!! Fresh udons! Cafeteria style! Tempura bar! Yea I know this place! I've been many time! Just not in Vegas!! And glad I did!! Thanks, Nelson!  Set up like the marukame udon back home: this place is bigger and have more variety on the menu!! Same concept! You come, you pick your udon ( soup, dipping, even fried), pick your tempura, pick your sides if you want any! And viola!   Me party of one dined here with enough food for 4!! Naturally! I wanted their yaki udon. Aka yakisoba style udon! It took about 20 extra minutes to get that dish. But Holy massive bowl Batman! It's HUGE! Like 3-4 bowls combined in one huge!!! It was huge!!! Good but huge!   The clam udon: very excited. A ok. The broth is too light but not in a flavorful way. I enjoy the clams!   The mini curry bowl: this was delish!! Totally enjoyed it!! And nothing mini about it either. It's a steal for under $4!!   Tempura are pretty good too. They were out of most things. I tried squid and the egg. All of this came out to under $30!! So much food! So much food and fresh hand made noodles! Total steal!! Totally worth a trek! Totally will be back! Oh and free yogurt drink with yelp check in!

zTQBCt3pzEJnhD6f5RpWVA.text: The best Japanese restaurant I've ever been to. The noodles have a light feel to them while every assorted flavors of each udon bring out unique but exquisite flavors. The onigiri or the triangle shaped sushi takes their flavor to the next level. Using I eat sushi feeling fine but their onigiri gives out the best flavors they can. Especially their spam onigiri which is my favorite onigiri. I recommend trying this place for the best Japanese food experience.

NUyRwbGvPR4hhwBKzp2bxw.text: AMAZING Japanese fast food! Food arrives in less than 2 minutes, options are plentiful, and food is very high quality! My bf and I got the #26 and #28 with an additional bao bun, and we were very impressed. The meal cost $21, and the meat was cooked to perfection! The pork belly melts in your mouth, and the bao bun, as my bf says, "was so much yum."

U_JZjyspGPPJK6FYK3_bag.text: Food is soo good! We are always satisfied every time we come here to eat.  Will come back again soon.

RGKiz5lhQZoS3OCIpz7Nag.text: I am a noodle/ pasta fiend. In the spirit of trying out a new place, I decided to give them a try for lunch instead of going to my usual places for noodles.   I blame myself for not going with their popular items, but that is why I will come back to try their more popular dishes. I got the Yaki Udon with extra noodles... not the best decision ever. Noodles were perfect, but the whole dish itself was very forgettable... so were my additions... I don't think I will ever order a thinly sliced kabocha tempura ever again for $1.25... Shrimp Tempura addition was better.    I also don't like pictures of food that is not the proper representation of the food itself. The Tuna Mayo rice roll looks nothing like their page. The picture used on their page is hand made, not machine made (i.e. used a mold) where all the edges were perfectly straight ... The filling was also lacking flavor and moisture from the mayo.  Now that I know what to avoid on my next visit,  I will definitely try their carbonara udon and other udon dishes with sauces.

l5wCO5SqIttwG1dkghuMLg.text: They definitely had growing pains to deal with after a massive turnout for their opening week, but I enjoyed myself the second time on a significantly less-crowded visit.  Cafe Sanuki is the latest udon restaurant to hit Las Vegas and they're on the "strip mall" side of the plaza on the southeast corner of Spring Mountain and Decatur. They have a cafeteria line and manage to get both noodles and rice bowls ready quickly, and they have tempura and onigiri ready for consumption between the entree station and the register.  During my first visit, I had the Mentai cream udon ($8.80), a low/no-broth hot udon based on pollock roe. The udon was certainly creamy, but the noodles themselves were softer than I'd expected. The portion seemed a little on the small side, but perhaps that's a trick of using a bowl that's so enormous as to feel a bit unwieldy.  The second time around, I picked the Ontama Bukake udon ($6.45), which is served with broth on the side. The noodles seemed to stay just a bit more al dente without constant contact with the delicious broth (presented on the side). The egg was pretty nice, with liquid whites around that "gelatinous" semi-cooked yolk. The bowl was a bit less unwieldy, although it still has an odd lopsided shape.  I also had a Miso Garlic Pork Belly bowl ($3.95 mini size). It was a good side dish, but I kinda wish that the pork belly wasn't sliced so thinly. It wasn't as complex as chashu pork at various ramen places.  I also had tempura both times. I'm not 100% sure if they use the typical panko breading, but they did get a crispy texture, so I'm ok with that. The shrimp ($1.75) was pretty good, but the other one had soft rubbery texture reminiscent of improperly cooked calamari. Upon second visit, I realized that it was incorrectly labeled as chicken the first time. It probably really is calamari. I didn't try it again, instead opting for the pumpkin ($1.25), which is soft inside and reasonably crispy on the outside.  I also took advantage of the Yelp check-in offer both times for a drink (normally $2.25). I did try some of their teas and their Calpico (new on the 2nd visit), but I kept going back to their house lemonade, which is a surprisingly creamy and light take on the beverage. Fountain drinks, fruit syrups, and hot hojicha tea are also available.  I'd consider returning to Cafe Sanuki for a quick bite in the future. They're fast, and the food seems almost as delicious as more typical udon restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara Udon ($8.80), inside another one of the massively oversized bowls
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. left to right: Fish Cake Tempura ($1.75), Shishito Pepper Tempura ($1.00), Chicken tempura ($1.75)
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted tempura in cafeteria-style line

OMVPNbVMSkrSFGDkOj5qSw.text: This place is as cute as its name! Cafe sanuki has an interesting set up. Once you enter, you see a physical display of all their food selections. It's perfect for visual people. To your right, you order and pay. Sometimes your food will come out while you're waiting in line & if not, they give you a little pager so you can sit down & wait. The pager system is a bit confusing... it seemed like our orders kept getting mixed up with other customers (so just keep an eye out on what you actually ordered). While you wait in line, you can grab a variety of tempura & onigiri. Yum!   I ordered the Untama udon & my egg was beautifully poached! If you are someone that doesn't want something too savory/salty, this is a good pick. Next, the mental! While there may not be much mental, it packs a lot of flavor! A little goes a long way.   Did I mention they have a huge selection with their soda fountain?! It's a bit overwhelming. They have a ton of flavors to choose from. Just try to drink a little before you sit back down. Two drinks I tried seemed a bit watered down.   Hey, Rachel! The drinks where Diet Coke & root beer :) thanks for following up!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fDeFoHHDKdsUk_1SsTN2Pw.text: Mentaiko cream udon was amazing! It's my weakness. Everyone else seemed to like their dish also. Would recommend and come back if I don't want to eat somewhere on the strip.

GRsZWbNqDTvcyCRjk16vpw.text: I love Udon! I stopped by here 3 days ago on MLK day for lunch. The place is hip, quaint, well lit and I love their lightings. The place was busy, a good sign!  The restaurant is set up like a cafeteria, you pick up a tray at the start of the line and order, and wait for your food to be prepared. You will walk across a small section of add-on items such as tempura, soft boiled eggs, spam musubi, chicken skewers. Then you pay and get seated and when the buzzer buzzed, you pick your food up from the counter. The young girl that rang me up was nice and mentioned they opened on Nov last year.  I loved the Niku Udon (Tender sliced beef on top of warm udon noodle). This was very reasonably priced at $7.45. I added an egg for an extra $1. I didn't care for the tempuras that I got as an add-ons. It wasn't as fresh.  The udons were absolutely delectable and the bowls was not huge but a good size. The broths were so flavorful and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Udon (Niku Udon)

3fWU21Iss4yxiCL1C6p5AA.text: Great find. Only downside for the visit was that the food arrived at an odd staggered pace. But it was fairly busy. Taste made up for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fHPxugMZQx9A6eA2TpLZ5g.text: Udon!!!!! What a fun restaurant! Located in the big lots complex off spring mountain and Decatur,  easy to get to,  and full of life.  It's set up kindof cafeteria style.  Inviting you in with a good food display of the dishes.    The food waa bomb! The udon was superb and super authentic,  and the fusion dishes were super tasty.  I had the udon carbonara, and a mini katsu curry.  Both extremely delicious,  but way too much to finish.  I will be back for a quick lunch of a mini katsu curry which is just enough for a meal.  Plus the katsu is a tonkatsu with pork which is my fave!!!  The drink and condiment station is super fun,  and you can get a fountain calpico!!! So tasty and satisfying after you destroy some noodles.

Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calpico!!!

vgP6k6MQCcrdM3_vAKzZZg.text: I'm not even going to write a long review for the place because it's pretty simple. Great Japanese food, not sushi, but actual food! The staff are super friendly and the food is always fresh. The best part is, if you don't like a dish or change your mind, they'll replace it! MUST TRY!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Bowl

ElruaUfnLdxW33g4PQPMHg.text: I should've read the reviews before I walked in because I didn't realize it was cafeteria style and stood there for a few minutes looking confused until it clicked in my head haha. I love the display of the plastic food as soon as you walk in. They look so realistic! It also reminded me of the time I was at the Japanese airport with my mom and little bro oohing and ahhing at the plastic food display because we never saw something so beautiful lol.   Anyways, I got the yaki udon and grabbed 2 shrimp tempura and 1 tempura fried egg. Once I paid for my food, the lady gave me a beeper to alert me when my yaki udon was done.   Sooo...this is the part that kind of irked me. I sat at the table waiting for my noodles and waited...and waited...and waited. I probably waited a good 20-25 minutes before a nice young lady came up to me and asked me if I got my food. I told her no and that I was still waiting. She then said she'll check with the kitchen and after a few minutes, she came back and informed me they were making it now and apologized for the wait. I'm not exactly sure what happened...maybe my ticket didn't go through? It was a good thing I wasn't in a hurry.   Onto the food, the tempura is bomb. So nicely fried and crispy without being heavy. The yaki udon was flavorful and the consistency of the noodles itself was nice. If I were to suggest one thing is to add more meat into the dish.   So even with the unexpected wait time, I do plan on coming back and trying out the other dishes that they offer and the lemonade! I've read the lemonade is quite tasty. Hopefully next time I won't have to wait as long.

foBVdcOY44nWcQYZcHQu5A.text: Cafe Sanuki, a Japanese Noodle shop that focuses on one noodle, Udon. Udon are thick noodles; thicker than Ramen Noodles.  You first order the type of dish you want, they give you a receipt, then you can choose side dishes such as Tempura (ex. Vegetable Tempura), Onigiri (Rice Ball), etc. The Cashier will total all the items together to give you your total amount.   I ordered the Mentai Cream Udon. Mentai Cream uses Salted Alaskan Fish roe cooked in a creamy sauce mixed with the Udon Noodles. I also bought a Salmon onigiri. The packaging are normal for the onigiri in Japan. There are specific order to open the package, so make sure to read the directions located on the bottom of the onigiri. The Salmon Onigiri was salty, but the creamy sauce of the Mentai Cream goes well with the salty Salmon Onigiri.   Cafe Sanuki has a nice atmosphere that goes with the interior design. I had a good experience at Cafe Sanuki and hope to go back soon. I noticed that they play Japanese music, some I was able to recognize~

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0o6bzuBlPqW-gwK3gtbZ4g.text: Upon entering the store you are faced with this large fake food display commonly seen in many Japanese eateries. You get a sense of how extensive the menu is. You make a right to the kitchen counter area where you place your order. The food is prepared right away and some of the noodle bowls are ready in no time. Your eye catches the several rows of freshly prepared tempura everything, hand rolls, takoyaki etc. You help yourself to a little bit of everything wondering if you ordered enough.  After paying you find a table in the large, well-lit dining area. You make a stop by the fountain drink area. Now here's a bonus, they have a Calpico dispenser, so if you love this yogurt flavored Japanese drink then you're in heaven. Next to it is the surprisingly delicious creamy lemonade. All of this with free refills. Now the food. We always loved carbonara udon and this is no exception, with large cubes of bacon in the sauce. Loved the niku udon with thinly sliced beef. We had to try the miso pork belly which was so flavorful. We also had shrimp and squid tempura, crunchy tempura spinach(?) and karaage on a skewer. All good! We were enjoying our meal so much we kept asking ourselves how come we haven't been here before?!!! I checked and they've been only open for about a year so we haven't missed out too much. Lots of time to make up for lost time. (= This place reminded us very much of Marukame Udon which is our favorite in Honolulu. Now we don't have to fly to Hawaii to get equally great food. Did I mention the service was also excellent?  --- Now on out 3rd visit. Still trying new things and loving it all. Did I mention that his place has really good value for your money? Most of the bowls/entrees on the menu is a $7-8. This our family's favorite restaurant.

qVACCh8RrutaVdyU-Mq2pA.text: My teenage daughter found this place on Yelp and what a gem! Cute display of all the food choices, as soon as you walk in. Friendly staff, super helpful. So many yummy choices, it was hard to narrow it down and we'll definitely be back when we return to Vegas. Great food off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Generous portions to say the least!
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bowl of delish noodles as big as my head!

_ARWR9t00v6gHSHJQ58Fiw.text: Rude service: I called to ask a simple question about parking at the restaurant. The person who answered the phone had a rude attitude like she didn't want to talk to me and then asked me to wait. Then I heard her tell her coworker, "I need help. I don't know how to answer this guy's question," and then just hung up on me.

Y5eP-bc_D6OCtUHGyGypHg.text: Our go to place during hot or cold weather. We haven't had anything here that we don't like as of yet.  The curry rice is good (can be a bit spicy for some), the donburi, udon, spicy pork bowl (can be spicy too), tempura items, and onigiri (tuna mayo and ume) are all good here.  Some of the bowls can also be ordered in a half size portion for smaller eaters, check the menu or ask when you order.  The soda machine is a pick your favorite coke product and you can have cherry, vanilla, lime, etc flavors added at the machine. Plus soft drinks are bottomless. You will need to bus your own tray back to the cleaning area between the dining room and the cafeteria order/pick up location before you leave.  Also fun is the typical plastic food samples of menu items when you walk in the door, just like Japan, designed for those who cannot decide without seeing what it looks like first.

jdEEtlth4X15vWm1f7uVKg.text: It was more of a casual place than I expected. You line up with a cafeteria tray and order, pay, then sit and eat.   The food was awesome. Plus, it was cheap. If the quality had been worse, I will would have been happy with the pricing. But it was fantastic. Definitely will be going again next time I need udon.

_6BKiwucORAwYS0usCdxmA.text: My sister, her boyfriend and best friend Chun posted this place on their social media which made me want to try it and I have no regrets!! The restaurant is something similar to cafeteria style. Which PERSONALLY, I think makes eating your food fun!   I had the Kake Udon, mini Katsu curry bowl, 2 shrimp tempuras & a drink! (I know I'm a fat ass) The total was roughly $12 & I got full pretty fast. The restaurant seating area was super space but I do have to say, the only down side is the area where you pick up your food. It can be a little crowed and I know some people can't tolerate it. But besides that, it's a great environment.   The staff is super helpful and nice! And did I mention that they serve Calpis as a drink option!? ALSO, you can add different varieties of syrups to it to taste better? My favorite, Calpis & Mango syrup. TRUST ME, YOU WONT REGRET!   Overall, I'm super stoked to have a place here in vegas that offers good authentic Japanese cuisine for AFFORDABLE prices. This place is a must visit! It deserves these 5 stars for sure!

fJejCEFswpZN3uI7QdiYHg.text: My daughter introduced this place to me. I really liked the flavor of the food and it was well portioned and reasonably priced! The cashier took three yelp check ins so we can have our free drinks with no issue and she helped my mom with her tray to the table. I have a new go to place for comfort food.

Ia-ppoQGTjKQqRMKmmCNgw.text: I've eaten here multiple times. Staff is great, super friend and attentive.   Ive had the Carbonara, the beef bowl, miso pork bowl, beef udon, tonkatsu, and the tomato basil.   All of it was really delicious.  Will keep coming back.

nbwdjIBqQsJbMMAEtCbTbQ.text: Went here for lunch. No wait. Great food. Great service. Great staff. Absolutely coming back here again.  For more detail: I walked in around lunch time and was immediately greeted in Japanese fashion. The cashier was helpful in that she was able to describe what kind of restaurant (cafeteria-style!) this was and how exactly to order and pay. My friend and I ordered, paid, and received our food in under 5 min; I ordered the beef udon bowl and a mini rice bowl, which came out by the time we paid (super fast!) while my friend's took a bit longer for the carbonara.  Seating was great, this place has a lot of room. The drink selection was great, ranging from soda fountain to calpico. Throughout our lunch, the staff was always there to make sure we were satisfied. Overall, a great experience and they definitely found a repeat customer.  Thanks, y'all!

Lx46y1drOK-XzGAb9FgRNA.text: Yummy udon just like from home at the Cherry Blossom Festival in San Francisco! The lemonade is just as delicious! I can't wait to have more!

oeqnKBVat1C8V-rhd0GaIQ.text: My newly husband and I came here for lunch which opened at 1130. This was our first time at this Japanese cafe and it was quite similar like the one in hawaii, Murakame Udon but this place had rice bowls and more drinks were offered. I really love this place and price were reasonable. My husband and I had the miso garlic pork belly and we shared different types of tempura and a pork belly bao on a steamed bun. Everything was delicious. I deducted a star due to the fact that not one or a few tempura asparagus was ready for grab in the start of opening and the fountain tea drinks were down and i love my ice teas. Anyhow, we will be back with the rest of the family. A good lunch quickie. Happy eats!!!

n8_D9BpLFp9dKjFqVrazuQ.text: This is how Udon (and most Asian Noodles) should be served. Cafe Sanuki more closely mirrors the style of restaurant in Japan where you aren't sitting down for an hour to grab a meal that takes moments to prepare and execute and requires almost no service beyond getting your food.  Walking in, you are greeted by the open style kitchen, a display of their dishes, as well as someone making and cooking udon noodles. You walk up with a tray and order, receive your udon unless it is one that takes longer to prepare, grab tempura with plastic tongs, and choose side dishes if you like. Then you pay for your food.   Then you grab any of the open tables and enjoy your food. When done, you simply leave your tray in a bussing area (not sure if we are supposed to clear our tray but employees seem to be cleaning up the area).  Quick, convenient, great value. And the udon is quite tasty too. I have had a chance to sample the niku, onsen tamago and the mentaiko cream udon. The beef was very tasty and tender. The tamago is imported from Japan and is organic and vegetarian, and the mentaiko cream had great flavor.  I had a chance to try the miso pork belly rice bowl as well - the pork belly was okay, but I'd definitely focus on the udon here.   A special note about their lemonade - it's a little creamy and light in flavor which is actually pleasant because it is not overwhelmingly sweet.  One thing to watch out for might be noodle texture. The first time we went our noodles were a little overcooked and too soft. They were intensely busy with a line out the door and it was soft opening so I won't hold it against them, as the second time was better.

l2Ovzsni6Ptp43h5UmNXXA.text: It's better than a 3 star but not quite a 4 star. I tried few different types of udon- clam, Zara, curry and ontama bukake. I also had few different pieces of tempura. Few things I liked about the place: The restaurant is spacious, and clean. The staff was helpful. Good size of selections.  Things that I didn't like: The udon was over cooked; they were a bite soggy. Tempura were greasy/oily. There was a trash can in the middle of the hallway on the way to the restroom.  I also had their famous lemonade, it was a decent but different cup of lemonade, it almost felt like creamy lemonade.  Overall experience was okay. I didn't have the desire to comeback soon but I probably will because my kids did like this place.

YYARyZoUdo5ZQhyn2Kkjgg.text: Great lunch. I was short on time and looking for a real food choice (no fast food garbage) This was the predict stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

duzPfuTJJCfLSKRXOnbQ8A.text: You'll literally feel like you've stepped into a restaurant in Japan. Once you walk in there is a display case filled with bowls so you have a visual of what they look like. There are also menus for you and there's usually someone that greets you when you first come in and asks if it's your first time. If it is, they'll explain the process to you but it's simple enough. Grab a tray and let the person working know what number you'd like then grab as much tempura as you want. Plenty of seating and workers are super helpful.   They offer extra noodle options for $2 more I believe. They make the noodles fresh and sometimes you can see them making it in front of you! The tempura is made fresh. I highly recommend the soft boiled egg and shrimp tempura. The sweet potato tempura was just eh. I think it could have been cooked a bit longer.   My go to is the niku udon since it has beef and the broth is light, not too salty. I've also added the miso garlic pork belly bowl to my niku udon and thought the pork belly was too salty. I was expecting sort of like a braised fatty piece but the pieces were very thin and on the chewy side. My friends enjoyed the curry udon and seafood tomato cream.  Their drink station offers teas, calpico I believe and coke products. Don't forget to check in on yelp for a free drink!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #3 niku udon

Jw0xyQP-d0pZuBDT43q0VQ.text: Come here almost everyday before or after work.Great food , great price. Strongly recommend their beef  bowl and curry ,its so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Pt8M-vykaIWn4huRxPoYgA.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.  Very cool concept.  The food is your typical tasty udon with a couple of different broths and temperatures.  But Sanuki goes a little further with the inclusion of tempura and oden on the menu to make you full on Japan.  You take a tray, put your order in, and make your way to pay, passing by all the fried goodness on your way to your seat.  Prices are very fair with the typical udon at $6.45.  Many options both vegetarian and with fish.  Quality, home-cooked noodles with a nice soft broth, though a little fishy at times.  I find udon a little empty at times as the dish is 95% broth and noodle, but Sanuki filled me up and was tasty to the last sip.  Very cool new entity in China Town.  Plenty of seating, easy parking, god eats...highly recommended.

SppUMkARWq9nubSVFptNrA.text: Very interesting place. You get your food like a cafeteria and then pay. The pork belly bun was good. The udon was only ok though.  Clean place.

bCPgVUvoBHAgZ6wFqKpF4Q.text: I decided to finally try Cafe Sanuki out during my trip to Vegas and was disappointed.   Customer Service: 3/5; The staff did not seem to know how to manage the dinner rush. They were running around the kitchen and getting in each other's ways while making the food. There were around 8 guests in front of us and we waited around 30 minutes to order. Cashier was struggling handling a call coming in and ringing up my food at the same time.   Food: 3/5; My curry udon was not hot and had a strong cheese flavor. My boyfriend's Nabeyaki was hot but lacked flavor. Tempura was stale since it has been sitting out for a while. Half the items on the menu (i.e. rice balls, some of the tempura, takoyaki, etc) we're not out.   Overall: Not impressed, if you want to try this place, come at off hours to beat the crowd so you get your food faster and maybe warmer along with more variety of food available. I wanted to try other foods but was irritated by the overall experience so I just ate the food we got.

TlZdtODdQwq8I5dWupanMA.text: I really like this place. The food is always so tasty. They also have in my opinion the best lemonade.  The staff is very friendly and the food comes out super fast.

gtwHaGzEMw1T_4htRCVejA.text: First time trying this restaurant they state "good for kids" and offer high chairs but guess what no infant changing stations. Therefore they should change that on their yelp review to not good for kids. I was tempted to change the baby on their table just to prove to them how lame their restaurant is for not being family friendly. I would not recommend this restaurant for families with babies because they're not supportive of that fact. Owner and manager need to get a clue!!!! I would not have supported this business if I had known this fact.

6Ii4O6RbD6Ad19Na_lymcg.text: I came across this restaurant somewhere it popped up in my newsfeed on Facebook as being awesome. I jotted it down on my phone for future reference. Having a taste for noodles, my husband and daughter decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised. Though it's cafeteria style, you are able to chose some dishes that are already prepared and also are able to order off their menu. My daughter and I had the spicy noodles that I must say are the best we've had in Chinatown. Just delicious also had some chicken on skewers and some fried tempura which I also really enjoyed. Large and spacious dinning area. My husband had the beef teriyaki #25 and liked it. The help was very attentive to our needs. Melody, one of the owners, was very kind and personable and gave us some extra chicken. We will definitely be back again #yummmm ~Highly recommended!

pazX52fhsJs8KO0GC9xGfg.text: Don't be fool by the good reviews. Udon was over cooked, soup doesn't have good flavor (we had Niku & curry udon). We also had the cultlet curry rice & miso pork belly rice. All not good. Restroom ran out of toilet seat cover & the paper towel was also out. Maybe to price was cheap but... very disappointed on all

YCwQuypwOlwwcdoJQR_0rQ.text: Great price for the food! I wasn't expecting much, but the noodles here tasted fresh and chewy. Clean restaurant and it's all cafeteria style where order and get the food in an assembly line. Overall thought this place was great. Quick service and cheap, yet fresh food!

fcR9ccV4MoUx_zZOD7JuZQ.text: My two little ones just love the udon noodles here.  The restaurant is very clean, food is excellent, and the staff is so friendly and we always leave with our tummies full.

iRfhDTCOShGLkofqSDhNRA.text: The plain upon was good. The kids liked it. Had the miss pork belly bowl... Very flavorful. The tempura sauce was good too. Had the fish cake and squid tempura. I would come back!

jSNKZHj4HtNxfsAL-nxrnA.text: Had a positive experience. Food was served fresh. Tempura was tasty. The air conditioning was broken so that made eating hot noodles a poor choice but I would recommend this place to all.

31SkrtnaAe3FplXRYfprfw.text: I'm writing this review as I'm sitting with my husband and friend and we're just all in awe of the breathtakingly amazing food we just had. It all started with a Facebook ad which I must admit are sometimes obnoxious, but for some reason Cafe Sanuki's ad got our attention and we decided to give it a try; I must say it was our best decision ever. Starting with the extremely clean environment (you could smell the cleanliness in the restaurant), the friendly lady who greeted us in the front and explained how their ordering system worked, and the food display exactly like you'd find in Japan, this place is a gem in Las Vegas! It's so hard to find a good noodle house in Las Vegas with authentic Japanese food, and Cafe Sanuki has impressed us all with their udon noodles, broth, the perfect tempura breading, the amazing pork belly bao (a must try), and yes, a calpico fountain machine!!!!! Needless to say, we're coming back very soon. Probably tomorrow.

V7EmL9lF2HtZmkMo9oGdMA.text: Love the udon this place, specially the Garlic Chicken Salad Udon. Price is good and fulfilling.

qZK3J-iVknSDeVw-8-D0jg.text: The service here is stellar. I've had three waitresses so far: Mary, Patty, and Tia.  They were all friendly and efficient. Their level of hospitality is rare in the dining industry now days.  The food was awesome!  Cafe SANUKI has a wide range of authentic Japanese cuisine prepared quickly with expertise.  I've had a few of the udon items and some the bowl items as well. They were all delicious. I also tried a few tempura items, rice rolls, and other tasty munchies. The prices are affordable, as well. If you also consider the pleasing interior design and overall atmosphere at this gem of coziness, you experience a level of flavor and comfort that is rare in the world of casual dining.

9Mwfu4ID0VH2756H-_CQDw.text: A good place to eat some Japanese food. The udon is really good n prepared fresh daily.

fW-AxDyIUB4_8hqLr30MRA.text: My family and I came her for Sunday brunch. It was our first time and we had an amazing experience from the time we walked in till the time we walked out. The food was absolutely delicious. Staff was beyond incredible with recommendations and also patient will our orders. Thank you so much Cafe Sanuki crew for this lovely brunch will definitely return and become a regular.

nJvn4eQxbI-qfcqx2phSKQ.text: Great food at very reasonable prices.  Mini bowls were fun for sharing and exploring the menu.  I wish one of these would open in Phoenix.  We would be regulars.

6srXcyK1CgInbc6icgQgXA.text: I ordered the nabiaki udon with a side of beef rice.  The udon texture was perfect.  The broth was very nice.  Everything was perfect.

aq9VOwX15yhG06hTC__ptA.text: Cool little spot with a Japanese cafeteria feeling.  I had the chicken katsu which was a pretty good portion and served in a huge bowl.  They have some pretty good lemonade with free refills there where you can add flavored syrup (guava/lemonade was pretty delish).  Also tried the tayaki fish bread thingy with red bean inside which was worth trying.

4W_A-9q6rV4uBGpq0hm3TA.text: Food was great but they didn't have much tempura's and onigiri. I wanted spam onigiri but all they had was 6 tuna mayo onigiri, when I asked the cashier she said that's all they have for the night and we came in 2 hours before they close. Kinda disappointed about that.

qZ43trs3Pt-rPJxLIW4QQw.text: My husband and I loved it. He got the cold udon and added tempura. I got the tokatsu curry rice. Being that the pictures looked much smaller than they are in person to us, we also ordered the Mentai Udon. 1 order is def enough for 1 person! Lol All the fried items are great. I really enjoyed my tonkatsu. Udon of course is the star. Texture was perfect. We were not crazy about the Mentai Udon, but that just comes down to our flavor preferences and not their execution. My husband is already wanting to go back and we went yesterday. Lol. Their lemonade is the best on the frickin planet!!! It is sooooo good. Their lemonade is seriously a must! Next time I'm getting the same dish that my husband ordered, the cold ramen and add some tempura. Until then I will be dreaming of Cafe Sanuki. Only reason they are not getting 5 stars is mostly because their beeper thing sounds like a fire alarm. It takes away a bit from the experience. They should rethink those alarms, maybe recalibrate the sound. A number of folks were remarking on the disturbance and trust me, you guys should quiet them down.

uIdFjSmzIdawOdpj4oqqnw.text: I went on a Japan trip last year and as soon as I walked into this place I got the same authentic feeling as an udon shop in Kyoto. The food was on another level of good. Pure feelings of nostalgia filled my head from my trip to Japan. I got a kake udon, which is the most well known udon. It was taste wise and looks wise just like the one I had in Japan. As I was ordering it, a man who turned out to be the owner asked if I want a soft boiled egg and I replied of course, which he replied with "that is the only way to eat udon." I later waved him down to compliment him on his success so far. He was one of the most passionate guys I've ever met. This place has so much going for it. I guarantee this will be the best udon in vegas!!

-rL1idIV1lZc-0bX9APK-Q.text: Wow!! This restaurant made me feel like I was in Japan again! I loved walking into the restaurant and seeing the display of the different items of food in a case! It was fun watching them make the fresh udon noodles, ordering was fast and easy. We had the Niku and Kitsune udon and the pork belly bun. It was all very good. Their house blend lemonade was refreshing and their strawberry covered with red beans and Mochi was a fantastic dessert! Will be coming back for sure, this place is awesome!

3217TWorOADrAVNt4UgqFw.text: Love coming here! Food and prices are great. First time trying the new dessert and it was delicious! Strawberry with red bean paste wrapped in mochi delicious combo. We will definitely be back!

_HNwyzBPESUNdAT76Mm2FA.text: This is my favorite Japanese noodle place in the world. They have great service and I would recommend this to anyone in the area looking for fast food but also a restaurant style of eatery.

sJeT_Ck78mVp1bd4hkw7Mw.text: The udon here is great nice setup here to get your food creative and traditional udon and plenty of sides and the bill was very reasonable.

eW9ikXzK37Kgi1czidjILg.text: I definitely appreciate that Cafe Sanuki strives to bring a fast-food styled udon concept to Vegas. Much of the set up is similar to restaurants in Hong Kong where the customer stands in a cafeteria style line, places the order with one of the workers, adds any additional items, and pays at the end of the line with the cashier. There are the sample fake food bowls at the front of the restaurant if you want to see what the food looks like before you order it.   The owner also seems to want to keep this place fresh by holding giveaways, meet a friend nights, etc. Basically a nice place to grab a quick (and healthy) bite to eat before going off on your merry way.   I had the opportunity to dine here twice, and while I appreciated the uniqueness of Cafe Sanuki - customized equipment and machinery brought over to make the best quality udon - I thought the items were too salty, lacking the simplicity of quality udon that I craved.   Beef udon: $7.45 very simple bowl of udon, beef, green onions, and broth. The beef was reminiscent of the beef found in Yoshinoya bowls - pleasantly sweet flavor with enough saltiness to keep you wanting more. Udon was cooked well; the noodles were cooked to the right amount of chewiness. The only thing that was off for me was the broth. I thought it was too salty. I know that this restaurant claims to not use any MSG or artificial ingredients, but that broth was too much - it ended up making the noodles too salty as well. I wasn't able to enjoy the dish as I got towards the end of the bowl.   Curry beef udon: $6.80 I thought maybe it was a fluke the first time I visited, so when I returned, I ordered something different. The udon came in Sanuki's blend of mild beef curry (carrots, onions). It was topped off with a ton of green onions. There was definitely enough flavor, but the curry was way too salty. I felt like the dish was too heavy, punctuated by the heaviness of the curry flavor. The beef and udon were decent though.   Pork belly bao: $2.95 each the bao definitely looked delicious, but again it seemed like it was coated with that heavy flavoring that I got from all the other dishes I've tried. A generous slab of pork belly with Sanuki's homemade slaw inside of the bread - good portion and price point isn't too bad, but I was not a fan of the taste. The slaw and pork belly weren't working together too well for me.   My friend ordered the carbonara udon with a mini beef rice bowl. He also thought the udon was a bit on the salty side and didn't think it was a satisfying meal as he had hoped for. I know a lot of people who do love the noodles here, so I'm not sure if I came on off days or something.   I love their drink area - tons of different soda flavors as well as an unlimited Calpico machine and their own blend of lemonade. They also have favored syrups if you want to customize your drink. If you check in on Yelp, you get a free beverage.   tl;dr - Prices are fair and they have a good amount of items to choose from. Food comes out fairly quickly and the workers are friendly. Unfortunately I just wasn't a big fan of the items that I've tried from here. I do want to return to try the rice rolls and tempura.

UX1Khcnnw7c6UKzx3y-m-A.text: Landed in airport and came here starving for noodles.   2 bowls curry Udon Karrage Chicken Gyoza 2 pork belly buns  Every dish we had was Luke warm. Even the gyoza which was made for us.   The price is ok, and the food is just ok. Nothing spectacular which wowed us.

a2EQJIUBz5vOtUID0jBSRw.text: Sure sure. I'll be one of the few three star reviews of Cafe Sanuki. I just don't get how serving food cafeteria style is any better than a traditional restaurant unless you're in a mad rush. We ordered our main courses (I got the nabeyaki udon which they informed me would take a few min). That's fine, that's how it should be. Moved on to the sides station and picked up a pumpkin and fish cake tempura, as well as a fish cake and daikon from the oden pot. We grabbed the last gyoza side so we asked if we could order one more and the cashier told us it would take 10-15 min. Okay, I'm already going to wait for my udon so no problem. But the cooks seemed annoyed to have to make more gyoza. I mean.. we're taking the last gyoza shouldn't you make more anyways?   So we sat down and munched on our first gyoza and sides. My mom's niku udon was done before we got out of line so she started eating. My nabeyaki udon and dad's curry came out about 7 min later. When your buzzer goes off they bring you the food so no need to get back up to claim it. The nabeyaki udon was quite good and full of hot ingredients in an adorable pot with handles. I enjoyed the pumpkin and fish cake tempura as well as the daikon. The fish cake from the oden wasn't as good. Hate to say it but it does resemble a warty finger and it's an acquired taste and texture. This is a lot of food so do be cautious with the sides cuz it's easy to grab everything that looks good.   About halfway through our meal the cashier came and told us they just started the gyoza because they forgot. Then she says "I don't think I charged you for it though" and looks at our receipt and said that she did. I don't get it. How much do you not want us to have that gyoza?? And that's my main issue with Cafe Sanuki. Most people are used to traditional restaurants, not quick on the go cafeterias you may find in Japan or Asia. We aren't rushing to catch a train, you can take 10 min to make our food. In fact I'd prefer it over grabbing it from under a heat lamp. Honestly the food was better than expected given most of it sat under a heat lamp but still. And I didn't get an option for takoyaki or some of the other sides because they weren't available at the time and who knows what they would have said had I requested they make some. It's like you get what you get given the time you go there. The udon was good and filling and satisfying, but at the end of the day it's just udon. I'm actually surprised they don't serve soba at all. Unless you're in a hurry or are seriously craving udon specifically I don't see a real reason to visit.

wxsVd7YJLJOM5-WJkNe1IQ.text: I think this place is pretty good. When you walk in you go up to order your food. For the soups they'll hand it to you there before you pay. For some other foods they need to bring it to you.   Both times I've gone, I got the mentai cream. It just seemed to be the most appealing to me. This ones very flavorful. KyYdekP66gsz4oKJE41pcQ.text: When this place was first opened up, we visited them right away.  I wasn't impressed then. I thought part of the issue that this place was a below par Japanese fast food cafe may be it was due to the "new" ness of the operation.   After two + years, my wife and I revisited the place today. Again, our impression was still the same. Nothing to get excited about.   On our first trip to this place, we felt the price is a wee bit high. After two years, they haven't really raised the price and we felt the price is now right in line with other restaurants.  As  a cafe/casual dining restaurant, the interior ambiance is pretty nice. Workers tend to be very helpful. Menu is quite large. One can always find some items that one likes.   The issue is the quality of the food offered. Nothing to get excited about. There are many other noodle places, ramen places that offer a higher quality.  One item that slightly ticked me off was that I ordered a Beef Gyudon.  On the menu it showed that there is an egg. I didn't get mine. When I inquired about that, I was told that is an added item, a dollar extra.  I took offense to that.  If it is not shown on the menu's picture that the Beef Gyudon has an egg,  I am OK with that. But to tell me that it would be a $ extra, it makes me feel that this is a switch and bait tactic, very dishonest advertising.

IVOwEa_MRu1xvSoLWiL5Cw.text: This place is unique. Lots of udon and non udon choices.  We had the udon soup that comes with shrimp tempura. It's is a very large portion. Come with a big appetite or share with someone who doesn't eat a lot.  After ordering it, there are some side dishes to order. Tempura fried: shrimp, squid, veggies.  I really like the seaweed rice rolled snacks. I would recommend the spam and the tuna mayo ones. It's so uniquely packaged to keep the seaweed crispy and then soft when you open it.  Service is so friendly! Very Japanese and welcoming.  Come try this place out. I've been twice and have enjoyed it both times.

9uIy5IYqvFZeB4uhFP5ZQA.text: Cafe Sanuki is a Japanese cafeteria style restaurant that specializes in the art of traditional Udon noodles. Their equipment and ingredients are imported from Japan. Prior to opening the restaurant, they met with Udon Masters and even had Minimoto-san spend several months in Vegas training their Chefs to provide an authentic Japanese Udon experience.   I was so excited for Cafe Sanuki so I definitely purchased more food than I could handle. As an appetizer, I decided to get some Tempura items. They have a selection of 10 different types of tempura and you are able to pay per piece per type. I chose Asparagus ($1.25), Pumpkin ($1.25), Sweet Potato ($1.25), Fish Cake ($1.75) and Shrimp ($1.75). The batter was very crispy and I really enjoyed every piece. The tempura is pretty pricey compared to the rest of the menu and since it lays around, it could get a bit oily.   The highlight of my experience is definitely their Udon. With so many options, I struggled to narrow down my choices, but eventually I decided on the #7 Ontama Bukake Udon ($6.45). This is a warm udon noodle with a perfectly poached egg, onions and tempura flakes with the Udon broth on the side. With the broth on the side, your noodles will maintain its' ideal consistency and the tempura flakes won't get soggy if you wait too long to eat it. The noodles were evenly shaped with the perfect amount of elasticity. After I poured in the broth and broke the poached egg, they mixed together and coated the noodles.  It was so delicious, I can't wait to come back for more. I would have been happier if there was more broth though.   With the order of Udon, the small rice bowls are a discount price. I couldn't pass up a good deal for variety so I decided on getting a small Curry Katsu Rice Bowl ($2.50). The curry was a bit lacking by compare but still decent. It was definitely good value.   Take advantage of the Yelp Check-In deal for a free beverage. They have plenty of drink options such as a fancy custom Coke machine, freshly brewed Harney & Sons Tea, special blended Cafe Sanuki Lemonade and even Calpico. Their Drink station even had flavor pumps for you to add to your preference. I just got the Calpico and it was very refreshing with my meal.   Since they are cafeteria style, please remember to take your trays and bowls and put them away. The workers actually went around to help clear finished plates and even when I took my tray to the trash area, they offered to help me put it away. Service was definitely friendly and efficient.   I highly recommend Cafe Sanuki. It was such an incredible meal for a good value. Well, good value if you stick to the udon and small rice bowl. Trust me, even the international Japanese travelers seemed to really enjoy this place.

3CT_qkZ5b9RTYBPBxqp_PA.text: This place is awesome. We loved the udon shop in Hawaii  (Murukame i think in Honolulu) and wished there was something here on the mainland. This was the answer. Flavorful broth and toppings. The price is very reasonable and portions are good. Will be our regular spot in Vegas from now on. The kids love their rice wrapped in seaweed that we buy for the road. Overall, it's a good recommendation to hit up this spot.

pp5zuS05Tiq8jj0dJ6cFCQ.text: Coming from the east coast, we are a bit starved for any Japanese offerings other than the hibachi shops serving up grilled meats and rice, or sushi restaurants. We don't get much of anything in the way of noodle shops, especially those making fresh Udon. I was craving it big time while on my trip to Vegas, and went looking on Yelp for a great place. I definitely found one here at Cafe Sanuki!  Absolutely worth a trip off-strip, and a must have for any locals, in my opinion. I couldn't ask for more on my visit. Friendly service, GREAT food, and very inexpensive. I love the format they are going with, which keeps people moving efficiently through the order process and gets them their food quickly.  There is a lot to like here. First and foremost is the delicious Udon noodles made on-site regularly throughout the day. You can get them in all sorts of tasty broths with a variety of spice levels and sauces, or you can even have cold Udon, if you wish. For me, I had a bowl served up in a personal iron kettle with various types of fish, shrimp tempura, a soft boiled egg, and lots and lots of flavor. I also sampled some of the ready to grab items on their hot bar, the fried chicken was excellent and crisp, and my salmon rice roll was good as well.  Another interesting thing about this place is the variety of drinks and teas available, there is something for all desires with just a standard beverage purchase.  I don't know the next time I'll make it out to Vegas, but there is no doubt I will be stopping in here again!

99V4lu-Q2lBTtYSQVWkxaA.text: Can't really complain. Reminds me of some of the udon houses in Honolulu Hawaii. Basically you order with a person that's cooking and there's a person at the other end being your cashier. While I find it inefficient, I find it culturally cool. The meals range from 8-12 bucks which is reasonable. What I really like about this really comes from the small things. Parking is not ridiculous. The inside is so spacious. And the unlimited drink is not a bad deal for 2.50 considering you can have soda, fresh tea, fresh Lemonade as well as Calpico, a yogurt drink! I order the Nabeyaki udon, which had Tempura, thinly sliced beef, and green onions with udon. It is perfect for those who want to eat a balanced meal. But it might lack the flavor or kick others crave. I would come back for a late night bite or after a dental cleaning.

m9oCYsH5SIPPO893fzdEtg.text: I love this place. My go to for great udon.  Never a bad meal and always very nice. The udon noodles have a great texture and the flavor is on point best spicy tan tan I think I've ever had

BWYXEBerG0EBGqDtlbcyxQ.text: Alright, so let's get down to it. My last review of this place was definitely sad but I'm happy to say that I am once again satisfied with this cafe.   In my last review, I had a complaint about the customer service that I had received.   With this visit I was very pleased with the amount of customer service I received. The guy who took my order had very good energy and he was polite. The girl who rung me up was also very polite. She was also patient with me while I pulled up my yelp check in.  The food is never a disappointment here. I had the Katsu Curry and The seasoning was spot on as always. The Katsu was definitely thicker than it used to be so I got full very fast. I love the cafeteria style of this place because I could grab whatever I wanted and since I'm sometimes in the mood for tempura this place is ideal.   This place definitely pleased me so I will be back.  Just a little suggestion for the owners though. If you're staff had name tags it would be easier to call out the ones who should step up and praise the ones who do a great job. Just coming from a Yelpers point of view.

YO54oRx2NTlhf8DkHNFl3Q.text: This place reminds you of Mitsuwa's food court with out the grocery store....we ordered:  Carbonara Udon - Not as good as the now closed Monzo and the pork belly was chewy af....  Spam Onigiri - Can't fuck this up   Small Order of Curry Rice - Not the best not the worst just everything you can expect from Curry Rice.  All in all for the price point it's not that bad. Don't expect anything over the top and at the same time expect to have a decent meal.

h3X-fzyGWs5_pWtuB-hJxw.text: I live for their plum onigiri and lemonade! Staff is always friendly, there's rarely a long wait for food, prices are very good for the quality and quantity of what you get. The interior is quite relaxing with plenty of seating (although the chairs are just wood). They play a lot of music from East Asian artists. Love this place to the point where I crave it everytime I'm I'm in the middle/south part of town!

eg399eSQaCHFaxebLxSKPQ.text: Late post, but we visited this place while in Vegas last month.  Wife and kids craved noodles. Took to yelp and found this gem.  Noodles are extremely fresh.  Price is low for the quality of food, they could easily charge double if they were closer or on the strip.  However what stood out the most was the service. There's a black gentlemen that greeted us as though we were old friends coming back home for a meal, he took our order, brought our food out, brought out extra plates for my kids, checked on us later to see how are, and then took the plates away... All with a genuine smile. AMAZING Service.... This guy deserves a raise! I hope the owners value him because some of the so called high end restaurants can definitely use him.  Will visit again.

RaWDU8TFBw1bw6hnqwhXuw.text: Great concept, going through a line to order then sit yourself.  The wait for food is still pretty long, the spicy tantan was not hot when I got it and it wasn't very good.  The standard udons are good, avoid the spicy tantan and the seaweed wrap triangles. The add on $2.99 bowls are a good deal.

zygyNoVaiWJrS0eCxTj9Ag.text: Very nice staff. The Udon Noddles are outstanding and you can not miss with their pork belly sandwiches. Need to try the lemonade, super creamy not like American lemonade at all. Great experience. Would like to see them open at 5 pm.' The noddles really are worth the drive to check them out. E09Q66VgzOJYxhQj95gfDg.text: This a great udon place! Unique cafeteria style ordering with freshly made udon with a variety of tasty sauces & accompaniments. They also have a tempura station for you to pick your favorite tempura.  Recommendations:  Appetizer: 1. Karaage Chicken 2. Variety of Tempura  Entree: 1. Seafood Tomato Cream  2. Cafe Sanuki House 3. Nabiaki  * We've been here a few times now with friends and there have not been any dishes that have disappointed.

6h-brb1-eHkGTi-jakKdwA.text: Was on my way home from a short vacation and we needed something quick on Christmas Day, and most restaurants were either closed or really crowded. This place offers a good variety of noodles and rice dishes. The soup noodle dishes looked better, so went for the tonkatsu pork udon. The pork belly bao looked good too so I added that to there order. This place is fast-food style in the sense that you order first in line l, then your food gets delivered to your table.   I liked the bao, but the tonkatsu udon soup was mediocre at best. If your just looking for something to eat and not really good, this place is fine. I can't even say it's quick, as the noodles took a awhile to get prepared and served.   Be sure to check in for a free drink.
