hOPWUlzz268pX1m4I5o85A.text: Disappointed!! I had high hopes so we packed up the tyke and drove down to try it out. When I first walked in I was pleasently surprised to see the display of some the dishes available. It reminded me of japan.   We walked up to the line and like a few others needed a moment to review and decide. This caused a confusion because the order area is small and the employees dont direct or assist very well. Wifey ordered kitsune udon and I opted for the big dog nabeyaki udon.  Wifey was direclty handed hers while i was given a little beeper device. We moved onto the tempura and what not's.   The tempura all looked as if it had been out for awhile.. soggy and not much left. Not a great sign considering they had just opened.. microwaved from the night before?  I wanted to have two pieces of sweet potato but there was only two so I left one for the next guy. Grabbed a few items and went to sit down.   Figured udon would be right out so I started to munch on the few items I got. Well, by the time the beeper went i was done. Ran up and got the pot in awkward hand off and made it back to table without spilling hot soup on any og the customers. Seems like the kind of thing liability would dictate the employees bring to you.  This was the first time i have ever had sukiyaki flavored tempura udon with beef in it. Gross.  I must add, typically when you are going to drop a raw egg you should bring the broth to a tempature that could atleast have a chance to cook the egg white.   The line was so long it wasent worth going back up to order anything else.   The last thing I will say and this is a biggie.. it IS NOT appropriate to play the movie blood diamond on the main T.V. in the eating area on a saturday. I really didnt need my kids to see or heat the young child soldier murder the innocent villagers at what seemed like a full volume AK-47.   This place was sadly fail all the way around.

ncVnH6XZqOeiRi56oLtQTA.text: Just arrived in Vegas, which was our first night, I decided to check out Cafe Sanuki for dinner.   There are tons of dining options, when in Vegas and I picked Cafe Sanuki based on the almost 5 stars reviews, food pics, & that its been so long I had Udon soup. Another reason is that I don't want to deal with the lines back in Honolulu  at a place similar to Cafe Sanuki which is Marukame Udon.   The hubby drove me down to Spring Mountain from our hotel. The parking lot was packed that night, but we were able to find a spot farther from Cafe Sanuki. Cafe Sanuki is located in the right corner of this strip mall. Upon entering, the cafe is really cool, feels like I am in Japan, with all the cute fake food display. It is cafeteria style with lots of seating.   I thought that from reading the reviews, tips, & photos, I would be ready to order, but I still took awhile to decide. Too many choices! We placed our order and here is where my complaints begin. Our order were: Curry Udon (6.80) Kitsune Udon, (6.45) add egg (1.00) add mini curry rice (2.50) Fish cake tempura (1.75) sweet potato tempura (1.25). When I paid for my food, I didn't get the mini curry. When I asked cashier, Gabby, she asked, did you get a beeper? No beeper, did not receive one, so she said she will bring it out. 5 mins pass, 7 mins pass by, I still don't see my mini curry. I walked by the register to ask about it and Gabby said that they are prepping it, because they have to cook it. I noticed 2 other table that ordered the big bowl curry received theirs. I also see the pot of already made curry sauce. Gabby wasn't very friendly and talking back to customer isn't 5 stars in my opinion. She cannot admit that she forgot about my order. The entire time waiting for my curry my Udon soup was cold. I received my Udon soup lukewarm so the egg didn't really cook, the egg was still raw which I can't stand.  Overall, my other half enjoyed his meal. The soup wasn't too salty which is good. Cafe Sanuki is an awesome addition to Las Vegas and cheap. My visit was a disappointment. Happy that I can cross this off my bookmarks.   Oh, FYI/ Free drink with Yelp check in & super cool that they have a Self serve Calpico yogurt drink.

SO6pAh6JO2RapoWfhYrgRg.text: Great food and customer service!  I enjoy the Seafood Tomato Cream.  It is consistently very tasty!

XNlGhbh3LEeef0DY9IQOxg.text: I'm usually a noodle type of girl but decided to mix things up and definitely glad I did! I ordered the curry rice donkatsu and it was delicious. The donkatsu was fried to perfection and the meal was really flavorful.   This place is set up as a cafeteria style joint. BBlsU2UQo_UZvBGuF2qwew.text: Great customer service by welcoming staff! Good variety on the menu, we ordered the Niku Beef Udon and Clam Udon with a side of poached egg, and a salmon handroll. The food was amazing, but I wish I knew the poached egg was cold.. I saved it for last with a few clams and broth, and it was kind of awkward with warm broth and cold egg yolk.. I love udon and I'm glad that this place satisfied me fully!

T4rye-b2CNiVZIvlyzpSqQ.text: I love udon noodles so once I heard about this place I knew I had I to try it! It's a cafeteria style restaurant where you grab a tray, order an entree, pick your sides and then pay for your meal.   The interior is very modern and the employees are extremely nice and welcoming! They always came around and asked if we needed anything. Since it was our first time they were very patient and explained how everything worked!   The udon noodles had a really nice texture and the broth was YUMMY. The portion sizes are large as well! I was full about halfway through my meal.   Check in on yelp for a free drink!!

qOq3jFWB2-VjngxSFBRnuA.text: Easily could say this is one of my favorite Japanese restaurant.  I'm a big beef bowl fan and would say that they have the best beef bowl in town paired with an egg.   They have a good variety of udon noodles and ready to eat tempura from their counters. The kitchen is visible and could see that they keep the place clean.  Also, the lemonade is better than hotdog on a stick and has free refills. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

P6QQBHB2S3LbEQDG78oKOA.text: This place is much overrated on yelp. The people were nice and the udon came out hot, but that was about it. The broth (Niku and nabeyaki) was very watered down, didn't have the homey richness I was craving. The tan tan udon was okay, just salty, not much depth in flavor also, just kinda like spicy salt with a little miso in it. All the fried stuff was cold despite being under heat lamps . Maybe it was because it was slower but it didn't satiate my appetite. The udon noodles itself wasn't that great. It did not have the silky chewy springy texture, it was kinda just mushy. Oh but the poached egg was cooked perfectly .

N4-BWKi3uuyIG2EaJncNDA.text: My lovely Japanese friend took me to experience Cafe Sanuki for the first time. Don't let the casual cafeteria setting fool you, the delicious food is paired with great service!  As you enter the restaurant, there's a huge glass case with all the labeled food options on display. Gotta love the instant visual upon arrival. At first, we weren't sure how everything worked (we were too busy staring at the food display). One of the staff approached us with a menu and explained: the food options are numbered, take a tray and fall in line to order and pay. Ordering is similar to places like Jason's Deli, but the kitchen is in full view to see your food being made to order. Plus everyone is engaging and friendly, even with all of our questions. Just before you pay there's a little station with tempura veggies and onigiri, ready to grab right away. After paying the drink station is close by, then you pick a table and wait for the beeper to sound off.  I ordered the nabiaki udon dish, braised pork rice bowl, salmon onigiri and pumpkin tempura. The portions are generous, and I was pleased with all the flavors. I had the pleasure of rolling my own onigiri, thank goodness it comes with instructions! The great service we received was a nice surprise. The staff walked around inquiring how the food was, and would offer to get things for you, which I haven't usually experienced in cafeteria style restaurants. The ambiance is nice as well, and everything was kept clean.  I'm definitely impressed with the staff's attentive demeanor in a casual setting and will frequent this place, thank you Cafe Sanuki!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised pork rice bowl, small size
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nabiaki udon, two people could share this! Or one hungry person like me could finish it
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice little setup while we wait for the food

voH001q2HvYMrSuvXcNWPw.text: Every experience I've had here has been underwhelming. We came here on a Wednesday afternoon around noon before the lunch rush. The restaurant is big with a cafeteria style set up. You order w/ the cashier and grab any hot items that are available for purchase on the counter like different types of tempura. There's ample seating.  Food  Seafood Tomato Cream: The tomato sauce was good. The sauce came with shrimp, squid, fish and mussel. All were good except the mussel was overcooked and chewy. The udon was extremely overcooked as well. I would order this bowl again but request to hold off on the mussel and request they not overcook the udon if I came back here again.   Carbonara Udon: Lacks flavor. Overcooked Udon again. I wouldn't order this again.   Pork Belly Bun: This was so terrible the lady remade it for me after seeing my face when I bit into the pork belly bun. THAT'S HOW BAD IT WAS! The pork belly was chewy. There wasn't any flavor. The bun was dry and hard on the outside. The new pork belly bun the server gave me was slightly better. She said sorry for how terrible the first one was because they forgot to put sauce on it. However, I will give them a pass on this because of how well they treated us. To offer to remake a dish shows they care about their customers.   Price   Inexpensive and probably one of the cheapest udon places in Las Vegas.  This entire meal was $35 w/ taxes and tip.   Service   Excellent, which is why I would return here again because I am sure they'll follow instructions well had I expressed I wanted the mussels removed and the udon not overcooked.   Overall, it was an okay meal. I would return again for one more try... but if that one is a bust then I will not come back again. I think a handful of visits should be enough to know if a restaurant fits your taste buds.   Happy Dining,  JT

They are thick, chewy noodles, cooked to perfection!Highly suggest coming here! The atmosphere is an open concept and very clean and well thought out. In addition, the staff, from the food staff, check out to bussers are so friendly and willing to assist! I was about to clear my tray and the man working told me not to worry about it that he would take care of it. I will be back!

Saj4kbg-P6lskMB_at7paw.text: First impression, great decor and environment. For the food, ehh. I ordered a #7, thinking that it would come with soup because that is how it is shown in display and on the menu. However when it was served, there was no soup and the noodles were warm. I was also served a sauce in it's container but no hot soup was with my order. So I thought maybe the sauce would be enough to act as a soup to dip my noodles in, but come to find out, the container was already empty... At this point I was very confused and realized my order was not correct. By the time I spoke with one of the workers and they gave me the hot broth, my noodles were cold so the broth did not settle well with the now lukewarm soup.  I never really ever complain about food. It was just really confusing because the customer after me ordered #7 as well and we both didn't get a hot broth or soup to begin with. This makes me question if the kitchen has been serving this dish without it's hot broth or soup. I expected it to be in the bowl with the noodles served hot, just as the menu depicts it.  To end this review on a better note, at least they got my boyfriend's order correct. He ordered a #10, which they had to bring out to our table. The lemonade is also different from other lemonades I've tried, interesting flavor.  Maybe we caught them on a bad lunch shift, so maybe next time I'll have a better experience.

kmhODoWHUcNn_LFAoeFTLw.text: Went for the Pre Grand Opening.  Took my udon loving Japanese mom, who approves this place as tasting very authentic. She likens the atmosphere and food as being like what you would find at a Japanese train station.  Amazing fill up food for a long journey.  I love the models of each dish in the front to "see" before you order.  The line passing the udon making station and the little to no wait for your food.   Getting to pick and choose the tempura was a fun experience.  And the Cafe Sanuki lemonade is the perfect tartness and not too sweet.  Add some Torani flavors if you want or use it for 1 of 3 ice teas in the fountain.  We ended up getting the Kamaage udon which was sooo much food.  But this was the best for judging taste of the noodles. And the clam udon which was so yummy.  Tempuras-asparagus, zucchini, squid, fish cake cake and shrimp they were all good for the squid was the best. Not too chewy but very tender.    All in all I would go back multiple Times!

AAx2SnuiqEbFEWPjysTa3w.text: The soft opening was a success. The environment gives you a sense of what most Japanese noodle cafes feel like. The restaurant stays True to Japanese culture and it just brings me back to my very experience in Japan when I was younger. I'm excited to see this restaurant sky rocket in the future.

lE_EbzkDkPL_TYx3qdC7wA.text: I was looking forward to coming here but was disappointed with their lack of service. I got there a few minutes before they opened. The woman who worked the cashier told three people who were sitting at a table that they could now order when it opened. She looked at me standing at the door and just ignored me, walking back to the register area. I walked over there and was a bit confused about the ordering system. I apologized and said it was my first time. She assumed I had been there before. I was confused about the sides she was asking if I wanted. For that reason, I thought maybe I had to build my udon bowel. From the picture, it appeared that it included all the necessary ingredients that were in the picture. I guess the sides were if people wanted more tempura, etc. in their udon. In the picture, it seemed it had more than enough ingredients, so I passed on the sides. They need to explain their process a bit. Finally, I got the udon. It was just OK. It was a bit salty and didn't have a smooth-tasting dashi base. I really do miss the simplicity in food that I found in Japan. There is another place in town that comes closer to authentic Japanese udon.

Vf9BfyHDtMiF4dmVRdCXgA.text: Not quite a huge fan. Everything isn't made fresh to order. It's a cafeteria style type of setting and my food didn't come out piping hot. Albeit the food was on the cheaper end so I feel like what you get is what you pay for. They have a unique lemonade drink that they say they make but i think it really is just mixed with calpico. Come here for just good food and to get full.   The food is not bad. It's good and average but don't expect 5 star quality. The servers are nice and their drinks have free refills. I didn't come during peak hours and this was my last meal before heading to the airport (which was a little unfortunate).   Plenty of parking but can be hidden depending on where you're coming from due to the gas station right on the corner of the parking lot.  EDIT: the business owner replied and said their housemade lemonade has no calpico in it, I respect that. He also said they make their noodles in-house fresh daily, and I agree with that because I did see this for myself but have forgotten.

vo47wtSFB3Ksp6M_u7CvvQ.text: I can't say enough about how great this place is. It was modeled after my favorite udon place in Hawaii. The food is fantastic and the service is even better. It is cafeteria style so they don't really have to help you much at all but they go out of their way to check on you. All you can drink calpico is amazing as well!  I ordered the seafood pasta this past time. Kinda funny how a Japanese person would order an Italian style dish in an udon restaurant lol. I tried it because it was their specialty. There are no words to describe how good it was! Delicious!!!!

The Tempura was pretty good & so was the Udon Carbonara. The Pork belly Bao was just ok. It has potential to be so much better, if maybe they would sear the pork belly, for some texture.   Got a free beverage w/ Yelp Check-in.

RVFVUK7xxZ9Uy0UkxRVpTg.text: We enjoyed our lunch at Cafe Sanuki. It's a Udon restaurant and offers tempura and other items (Onigiri, Curry, Bao, etc.) as well. At the entrance, they have the offerings in a large display for your review and they all look good. Order at the counter, proceed down the line to the "buffet" like area where you can select your tempura and other items. Tempura is difficult to cook properly, crispy, light and not doughy. Cafe Sanuki had it right. The entrees looked great when they arrived at our table.   The hostess was friendly, the staff was attentive and the interior was bright and clean. We plan to return!

3Wy8Mc74N4JBhDAH9uCv4Q.text: This was my first time here and now is one of my fave Asian spots! Its kind of a self-serve buffet line. You order, pick & grab items, and pay up front. There's a lot of options too! Definitely have to come here more often so I can try everything.  I decided to go at lunch time and it was a bit busy. I got the udon and a few pieces of tempura. I wanted to grab some rice balls but they seemed to have ran out at the time. They're also known for their creamy or milky lemonade and its amazing. At first, I thought it was a bit odd but give it a try. It's so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2CGkAmAZtRG8QrVgaA60PQ.text: This place is pretty awesome. Great food and service even though you don't get served.  When I entered I was asked if I had been there and explained to check out the menu and order around the corner. The lady was nice.   I ordered the Beef Curry Udon and mini pork katsu and loved both. The noodles were ready before I paid. The flash them to perfection in some fancy machine for 5 seconds or so and slap some beef curry over them and bam insta huge bowl of some of the best noodles I've ever had. Good portion and just lots of flavor. The noodles are soft and perfect.   The katsu was very good. The pork had a nice crispy breading and tasted great mixed with the rice and curry.   The lemonade is so smooth and great, what a treat.   I'll be back for sure and suggest you check them out. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the super twisty straws. Makes me smile.
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara Udon: This is great!
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order only $4 is lovely

bJFxCT-qT9hh9gSyITQOvg.text: My tummy thought "man, udon did it again" after consuming a bowl of udon noodles from Cafe Sanuki.   Cafeteria style restaurant where they sell rice bowls and udon noodles. Very fast and extremely friendly service.   The wooden decor inside is awesome. Mangas of various anime's are stacked on the wall. Spacious place and plenty of tables. Also has free WiFi!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ujm6is-nKhS-WFjcxm89Og.text: This restaurant is amazing! The taste of the curry udon will definitely keep me coming back. The pricing for each of their entrees are the best bang for buck since the cost is low and the quality is high. The employees are friendly and efficient as the wait time for food was minimal even during busy hours. The menu is very diverse and doesn't just appeal to soup lovers. I recommend Cafe Sanuki to anyone who wants some quality Asian food for a cheap price!

3cL7u_iMUjvCApmgU1tmKg.text: Great casual place for udon noodles. The eatery is nice and big to accommodate big groups, kids and just a lot of people who want to eat a quick and fast meal. The restaurant is self service style. Order at the counter, wait for you food or get a pager to wait for your food at the table and then pay. The hot noodle soups are always steaming hot and tastes healthy and good. The fry station at the counter has a few fried foods ready made to pick up such as shrimp tempura, fried chicken and vegetable tempura. If the tempura were steaming hot and fresh it would be the best. Overall a great casual place to go for a quick and good meal with friendly staff.

CtlWiDCeZJV7VPyVJhAGkg.text: I had been eyeing this place since before it opened, and have had the pleasure of visiting them several times now.  I can't believe that even my husband loves this place. The noodles are great. I love the way the ordering system works too. It's not your usual place where you have to wait on someone to come over to get some more food. It's more cafeteria style, but doesn't feel like a fast food place at all. As you wait in line, you also get to see the chefs working on the noodles. It's pretty cool!  The first thing I ever ordered was Kake Udon, since it's just about the plainest you can get, and they did right by it. On another occasion, I ordered the Braised Pork Belly rice bowl, along with some Kakiage tempura. Once I was done with the pork, I mixed in the Kakiage into the remaining rice, and it was to die for!  Each time I visit, I also order Kombu Onigiri. I can't go without one! Husband swears by the Spam Onigiri. The Pork Belly Bun is great too.  Lastly, whenever they have it available, I try to snag some Taiyaki.

gnGzNpdZGI_-dl83l-v-aQ.text: The nebanyaki udon and clam udon was great! Few things to take note :  1-We order the pork belly baos, chef came out minutes after purchasing that he was out of pork belly baos.   2- We got 2 mini bowls in place of the "pork belly baos" which really didn't solve anything.   3-Included in the order was also katsu curry bowl that was long delayed. Went to cashier and she said they forgot the order. Took about another 40 minutes for that dish to come out.  4-The buzzer buzzed i walked up to get the food as I'm reaching for the dish I was told it wasn't for me they buzzed the wrong number.   5. Was told one of the chef walked out on them earlier in the day and they're short staffed, but there was 6 people behind the counter at 8pm with only 3 other customers. Hmm.   Overall, good food but lousy experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L68EGNoKzieWgMAgv2Lzyw.text: I had high expectations for this place based on reviews with some comparing it to Marukame in Waikiki. It just wasn't even close to. Everything really was just ok. There were not very many diners so I'm not sure if we didn't get fresh food or what but it wasn't good.  It is set up cafeteria style and you go through the line and order your noodle bowl and then plate your own sides and extras you want to go with, then you pay and they give you a pager for when your noodles are ready. Nice setup and nice interior design but food needs to match.

caHAIZ-Qa6XK0-6Krerv7w.text: I've been wanting to come here for the last month or two, and I'm glad I finally got my chance. I've been wanting to find more Japanese restaurants like I'm used to in LA, and Sanuki caught my interest. Ramen seems to get all of the love, so it's nice to have a place that serves good udon. All of the employees were super nice and helpful! The restaurant was very clean, and larger than I thought it would be. I had the Nikku Beef Udon, some assorted Tempura and a couple of Rice Rolls. I definitely enjoyed all of my food! The udon was chewy in the way it should be, and the soup was light and flavorful. Make sure to order it with an egg! The tempura was crispy and rice rolls were even better than the ones from Mitsuwa in LA. Looking forward to cooler weather, when hot udon tastes best! I'm sure I'll be back before then.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nikku Beef Udon w/egg

-J9Q24DETFklYarHjoFSHg.text: Very Tasty! (and huge udon bowls too!)  My friend and I walked in around noon on a Thursday... it was pretty quiet and just a couple folks enjoying their bowls which was good because my GF has an enthusiastic 11 month old who hasn't learned her "indoor voice" yet.  haha!  We were immediately greeted by a nice gentleman who welcomed us in and explained the menu, answered our questions about different dishes and took our order.  Actually... we told him and he shouted it back to the kitchen staff.  When that place gets busy, I'm not sure how that works out cuz I can see it getting noisy in there.  Anyways...you order some of the menu with him and then there's a buffet style area with prepared small dishes such as tempura and rice ball-things (I can't remember what they were but they looked like what my grandma would make for snacks... which were in essence rice-balls with stuff in them.)  Drinks are self serve, as is seating so you can pick where you want to sit, and then they'll bring your food out to you.  I had a big bowl of one of their popular ones...Nabiaki Udon. The beef broth was fabulous.  Hot, lots of rich flavor, just the right amount of saltiness.  Lots of noodles, shredded beef, a shrimp tempura, an egg, a couple slices of fish cake... So ONO! My GF got a spicy pork shoyu udon bowl... and it was totally different from mine.  We were trying to share but because the flavors were so different (in a good way) that we each ended up just eating our own.  But the pork belly that was in hers was fantastic! The pork bello bao we ordered was good.  We were chatting too much and it got cold. I think it would have been better hot.  Next time we'll know better. Each of us didn't finish our bowls but we put a pretty good dent in them.   If you plan on getting other sides, you can probably share 1 bowl for 2 people.  Service was really nice.  The staff checked up on us a couple times to see if we needed anything else.  If it was closer to where I live, this would probably be a regular stop for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE! And flavorful...yum.
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was for 2 people...our eyes were bigger than our appetites! Next time, we share 1 bowl.

XyjM_rz38f4nrrpazg7Wbw.text: Very authentic Japanese udon. Has this Hawaiian tastes to it also :) Pork belly bao melts in your mouth with plenty of shoyu flavor. Udon is made fresh, and tastes light and refreshing on a hot summer day! I will be coming daily for my lunch while I am in LV!

That atmosphere is very welcoming and the crew rocks. It is located by Chinatown. Reservation is not necessary and there is plenty of parking. Yummmm they have a great selection of udon or soup. And they have some great appetizer. I will definitely come back here again. Have a fantastic day! :

wJOdMiYrqxhIZxqWqiBxMw.text: I went here as a recommendation from my friend! I was confused on how it worked at first, put the staff was helpful in guiding me on how to order. I went basic and ordered a katsu curry (one of my faves to order) and I was not disappointed! It was not spicy (which is what I prefer) and the katsu was cooked perfectly.   I also ordered a pork belly bao which I had to take home because my portion of the curry was pretty big! The plates and bowls are HUGE. It was almost difficult trying to eat inside my oversized bowl, but the food was so good that I didn't care.   On top of it, if you check in, you get a free drink! They have a wide variety of drinks. They have the coke machine that have a lot of sodas in of itself already. But there's teas, lemonades, and a calpico station! I was very intrigued and happy with my experience there

0eBxrbnJ2vOWC1oy3Nnpbg.text: After a wonderful experience coming here on a whim last year (wait.. did I not write a review?? omg.. i'm horribly backlogged..), The gf and I came back for some more udon. The menu has quite a variety, and the experience is great.  You grab a tray and then proceed to order what you like with regards to your main noodle dish. You watch them as they prepare it and afterwards you collect and proceed to checkout. On the way, there's additional small bites as well as a tempura bar that is all priced a la carte... Get what pieces you want and they'll add it up. it is all very cafeteria-like.  Their creamy lemonade is very interesting and has an interesting flavor. I believe they use sweet condensed milk in their recipe that adds the creaminess they advertise as well as that additional sweetness. They also serve Calpico and it's all refills!  Friendly staff, wonderful atmosphere, good food.

Zc6foR3iCdLpRPcMZ8BsoA.text: Very good price for very good authentic food!! You also get a large portion. The environment is great and friendly, and they play music.

hFiF8PNhrf41Bfnu7i7oUg.text: This place revert me back to Japan when I came and visited. Entering the restaurant you'll see several diagram of plates and serving of how your food will look like. It's a fast and self service restaurant. The cooks and attendant are nice and friendly.  I had the fish cake which is extremely tasty. The tofu ramen broth was tasty but I feel like the sweet tofu didn't go well with the ramen. The best part of the experience was the unlimited calpico which is divine.

Vw8iB-q2YWaAylshntNozQ.text: As soon as you walk in they have a display of every dish that they have on the menu. This pescatarian has never gotten a seafood dish under $10 anywhere but I'm amazed at this place. SUPER clean and we came at 3:00pm on a Sunday and it wasn't busy at all. I definitely over ordered cause I wanted to try everything. We took some rice rolls home and order the seafood tomato cream and the braised pork bowl. The food came out within 5 minutes and looked and smelled really fresh. I was amazed at how much food came on my plate and they weren't stingy with the seafood. I will definitely be eating the rest for dinner. If you check in you get a free drink and their lemonade is something to try if you like Calpico. Free refills!

L6eHjLVpFjDSMpeUhImk8Q.text: I have wanted udon since I went to Marugame Udon in Hawaii. I love cold udon.  vegas is hot and this was the prfect meal. This place is perfect for all seasons :) hot or cold options for everyone!!! When you enter, you grab a tray and tell your order at the order window. You continue down and the staff maybor may not hand you noodles, dipping sauce, or your hot udon. It all depends on the prep time they need. It is QUICK though. Once you turn after that, you will see the fried goodies such as tempura shrimp, fish, veggies, etc. CHICKEN KARAGE IS SO GOOD.  Grab it to share!!!! I felt like the takoyaki was slightly overcooked though.  --Mujina cold noodle ($7.80) super filling! I also had some appetizers, so i think it would be the perfect serving by itseld. The sauce you pour over it is amazingly flavorful. I thought it wasnt enough but they give you the perfect amount.  --Nabeyaki: my boyfriend ordered this and i thought it was delicious, but i definitely prefer the cold noodle since we are going into summer and it's freakin hitting triple digits outside.  Highly recommend. I came right when the opened so there wasnt really a line. There is a LOT of seating inside. You almost feel like youre in a cafeteria. e n j o y

MKhsGzItVmcz6JLyU8G4ZA.text: I'm an udon lover, but I've never had it fresh. This was such a pleasant surprise that I wish I could bring it home with me. It was a spacious, clean, modern japanese environment with energetic staff and an amazing array of food as soon as you walk in. The udon was SO fresh, and what a difference it made. Hands down my best udon experience yet!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was my first taste of octopus! It was very tender and savory.
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pork belly udon was delicious, and the pork belly was so tender! I wish I had fresh udon every time.
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food our group ordered. All of it was delicious and the udon was so good fresh!

LAnRnosNocPUH94w7WT5rQ.text: Loving this replica of a typical Japanese cafeteria with delicious udon noodles.  You enter and are greeted by sample dishes behind a glass.  It is delightfully weird, and apparently traditional.  You go to your right, pick up a charming wooden tray and then order from a paper menu or the board.  You can interact with a young man who can explain everything to you. And then as you go along the station, you have the option of adding tempura to your tray on a little plate.  Don't forget to pick up the free condiment of colored sea salt.  At the end you pay, and you can add drinks.     We ordered the beef udon noodles, a pork version, and a couple other dishes.  The beef udon was warm and filled with umami.  The tempura was at first just okay, but if you dipped it in the little sea salt, it really brightened up the flavor.  The other dishes were good, as well.   The drinks are interesting.  There is a Coke machine that also has "fizzy" healthy drinks, as well as iced tea in 2 flavors (unsweetened), and a very fine lemonade.  Service is very good, particularly for what is essentially a "fast food" place.  It is clean and well-organized. Prices were not SUPER cheap, but reasonable, and probably not as expensive as the comparable place in Japan.  Popular with families.  I had no complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese lights
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu curry
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura options

nIhgE8AdvlgqB6NaKgwYWA.text: this is not my first time having Cafe Sanuki. Usually a decent place to get udon but I made to-go order for a beef bowl today. I was a few bites into my food when I found HAIR in the beef!! If you ever had their rice bowls to-go you'll know they put the meat and the rice in separate containers. When I scooped some meat to my rice container I found hair along with the meat!! I called to let them know and they told me to just go back with the food and they'll give me a new one. Went in there and got my meal replaced with a new one, that's it. I didn't expect to get compensated with free food/refund or anything but I did expect an APOLOGY for even finding that in my food. People in the back looked annoyed and so did the lady on the register. Definitely won't be coming back if they're so careless with their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Bowl

JkmN9EKEYcjtsp3Ku-0Pdg.text: We ordered the tonkotsu shoyu udon: broth was good and tasted healthier, egg was cooked perfect, pork was very tender pork sauce over dry udon: good but I'm not a fan of dry udon  curry with rice: basic, nothing special Udon was good and tasted fresh Good service!

gKU8aZ9wbXJpqnF2OhIMZA.text: I never understood how amazing udon was until I got to eat at Cafe Sanuki.   Do you ever want to fantasize you're a character in Terrace House having your first date where they specialize in udon?   Then come to the cafe Sanuki for the delicious , authentic, and reasonable cuisine !

zIczHhTa8NIBIof-nO7PUg.text: After trying Marukame Udon in Honolulu, it's hard not to compare every other udon to theirs!  Cafe Sanuki is similarly modeled to Marukame, with cafeteria style trays and self serve tempura. Unlike Marukame however, the tempura was not fresh and seemed to have been sitting out for quite some time. This is definitely one of the drawbacks of having a cafeteria style restaurant. Additionally, the noodles/soup did not seem as fresh as Marukame. We ordered the Nabeyaki & Carbonara udon. Both of our dishes came out slightly warm rather than piping hot.  TLDR Cafe Sanuki is OK at best for a quick udon fix. Nothing too special here.  If you're craving good udon, I suggest oodle noodle down the street for freshly prepared food that hasn't been sitting out.

5Hspee1EXRB58xX5IJkbdw.text: TIP: Free drink w/ Yelp check in! (They have those soda machine that you can customize your drink, calpico, and a bunch of lemonade and teas.)  After a long night out at the club, we were craving some soup the next day for lunch. Decided to come here since it resembled Marugame Udon and Marugame Monzo in LA.   ENVIRONMENT: Located in Chinatown (about 5~ min from the strip). The interior of this place is modern, yet authentic.  Upon entering, you're greeted by this big display of fake udon bowls for you to preview their menu.  The staff were pretty efficient! However, I felt like there was no need for the buzzer since the staff brings out the bowl to you anyways. Maybe just a number sign is sufficient enough.   UDON: They offer traditional bowls and some unique ones, like the carbonara. I had a bite of #14 cheesy carbonara, which is baked udon in a cream sauce. The flavors were all there, but extremely oily. There was a pool of oil at the bottom of the bowl. I ordered #3 Niku Beef Udon. The broth was extremely salty. I had to drink so much water... They were very generous with the beef though! My bf ordered #2 Nabeyaki Udon, and I would recommend that over the beef udon because it had more components (beef, egg, shrimp tempura, fish cake) and the broth was less salty.   RICE BOWL: I tried the braised pork rice bowl. It definitely needs some sauce to go with the pork because it was so dry. It was flavorful though, just very dry.   ONIGIRI (RICE BALL): I tried the tuna mayo onigiri and it was not bad. Nicely salted and decently flavored. The amount of meat wasn't much inside, but it was still a great snack.   OVERALL: This place has a plethora of udons to choose from! If you have a big appetite, you can order double noodles for $2 or add a mini rice bowl for $2.50. I love that the udon is freshly made. Although the broth was salty, it definitely hit the spot for the most part and I was content!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy carbonara
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #2 Nabeyaki udon
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

azvhi_XxmZmPjgVEw_xRLw.text: Very good, very delicious, noodle is good. Very big bow. Stylish.  Nice service as well. Clean and nice environment.

Eoego66tgVZ5vvczIT5xKA.text: Beautiful interior, interesting ordering/serving style where you get a tray and get all your items first before sitting down. All of the food was excellent, from the udon noodles to the broth, to the tempura and the oden pieces. Nothing too salty or sweet. The drink bar was also with a great variety and flavor to all their unique selection. Will be coming back as much as possible!

0pb60sgotFnhOxVDUYeILw.text: We Uber'd over from the strip and it was well worth the trip. Great staff and excellent food and very reasonably priced. The katsu curry bowl was tremendous and the portion was massive. Would highly recommend.

6NSfjJN1f-FkTpB61zQ6kw.text: Can't wait to return to this great little Jewel. Staff was very enthusiastic and helpful. So many dishes to choose from, that's why I'll be returning to this restaurant. I had the Curry Beef Udon dish and it was very good, not to heavy on the curry flavor, and good size serving for the money.. Hope they will open another in the south west of the valley.

HQCQErDtIZ_7kM__6SYfGA.text: Reminds me of the shopping mall noodle shops in Japan, especially Nagoya.  Quick lunch-line service and cafeteria-in-Japan atmosphere put a smile on my face.  The best part is the community seating, kinda like a beer garden - your close to your neighbors and you might meet some interesting folks, too!

7WluXVTL_JaXF7LiET1blw.text: Best place ever! They have a few options for vegetarians like there basil tomato udon, various tempura vegetables, inari, and onigiri rolls! Service is really fast and the people here are incredibly friendly. I also enjoy their drink station where you can mix your own flavors into your drink!

1e9RYYNgmG9948hrLbEH5Q.text: Under yelp reviews came for dinner and was disappointed. We were expecting authentic udon but our meal was pretty disappointing. Tasted like what we would be able to make at home on our own. Having said that the cafeteria was very clean and spacious. Seating was comfortable for our family of three with an infant.

PnRC-iBCX848d5jAZOOcmg.text: Awesome food at great prices excellent service clean place all around good. Will definitely be back again to keep trying the different menu items.

-4cnlaNBEuiBBew5QCqO3w.text: Quality food for such a steal price. What more can I say? The first time I experienced a similar restaurant style was in Hawaii. I'm like 90% sure it's the same restaurant that the owner of Cafe Sanuki visited and became inspired to open his own! Prior to my visit, I've been constantly checking out their yelp page, drooling at the images posted by other fellow yelpers. Finally, last week my boyfriend and I found the time to check it out. I tried their beef udon and it was just heaven in my mouth. I also love  the idea of picking out tempura, although I have one slight complaint about it...it was a bummer that the tempura was kind of cold..my guess from sitting out for too long since it is served cafeteria style. It's definitely not something that would stop me from coming back, because I assure you, I will be back. But I hope that they'll do something about maintaining the tempura temperature or something!   Amazing service as well. I was greeted instantly and was well informed of how to order and everything.   Definitely recommend this place to anyone!!

so2fUfb1W68__K7mDFgYCg.text: Food was decent - satisfied my craving , noodles were good texture, but the line got held up waiting for more tempura to be made. Overall staff was very nice and courteous.  However, my experience was totally soured by the stores ?manager?. He was standing in the middle of the walkway to additional tables while talking to some guests and just wouldn't make way for me to pass. I had to get up and down getting stuff from the utensil station since there was nothing at the tables and had to pass him every time but he never made notice that he was blocking the way or apologize. I actually had to walk around to the other side to get past him to my seat on one occasion.  Later I heard him speaking rudely to his workers, which I don't appreciate. If he is the representation of the business, then there's no need to return.

hyb4aWtisbR3zKph5H-LMw.text: Really good place for relaxing and good food, the choices are outstanding and the way they make you order your food will bring you back a nostalgic feeling.

YgLfqG_mqPs7C47NDGjmiQ.text: We love Udon. Based on reviews we were excited to try this place out. Unfortunately the food was below our expectations. We had some nabeyaki udon, shouy tonkatsu udon and pork belly bao. Bao was without any taste and cold. Both soups were just average and plain. Not the typical Japanese experience but rather americanized fast food place. We won't be coming back.

vXO2wSdNikcIVOE1lt0O0g.text: I would give this place a 4 star for the rudeness of several of the female workers but, that would not be fair to this place because the food is just so dang good. My wife and I order the Kanuki udon and the curry udon, the guy that was frying the tempura offered to fry us up fresh stuff so we got the shrimp and sweet potato tempura with a spam onigiri, tuna mayo onigiri, and salmon onigiri. The spam onigiri was a little old tasting like it was sitting out all day because the spam was turning gray.  We love the whole atmosphere and brought me back to shirokiya memories in Hawaii. This is by far the best udon I've had in such a long time. It's made the way they do it in Sanuki Japan. The noodles pick up the flavor of the broth which makes it taste great.  We will be back here to try out more on the menu because they all look so ono (delicious).

zXSMHTI23FlC1nHz36Ub_w.text: Loved the cafeteria style to this place- food was good, would definitely come back- kids love noodles!!!'

FMnNaRC6Zfjnj6Ts8RQgXQ.text: KNOCK OFF ALERT!  And it's a great thing.   Cafe Sanuki is a knock off of Japan's largest udon chain Marugame (for Hawaii yeeps, think our own knock off, Marukame).    Also guessing it's Chinese and not Japanese (kunbu - Chinese on the menu vs KONBU - Japanese).  It doesn't matter as many everyday noodle shops in Japan are Chinese.  Making this place "authentic".  Go fig.  Machine made, glutinous and chewy, properly cooked udon.  Very basic Sanuki broth (lighter style, soy added to a simple bonito / konbu (dried fish / dried kelp) broth).  Ordered cafeteria style, pickup a few pieces of tempura and a musubi, pay and eat.  In and out in 10 minutes without making a dent in your wallet.  The kake (finished broth) and bukake (stop it, dirty minds - add your own concentrated broth) easily the best and the best value at $5.55.  Variants include adding meat (niku), egg (kamatama) and cold (zaru).  Lots of yoshoku and silly Americanized combos as well.  None sampled.  Seriously?  Seafood tomato cream udon?  Very ordinary tempura.  Excessively oily, over cooked, somewhat rubbery from having the batter over mixed.  You get what you pay for.  For between $1 - $2 all good.  Musubis also just OK.  Everyday short grain rice, typical "fillings" (spicy tuna, tuna with mayo, plum, spam), crisp laver surrounding it.  Over compacted but flavorful inari (cone sushi).  Again, sub $2, what do you expect.    New, clean and friendly service.  Solid, quick and cheap just as it should be.

cwPPBtw5UQPvxXUX-ueRlg.text: Yum! I love their takoyaki balls! And all you can drink soft drink Station. I will be back to try everything!

soIy5cbFd4MzGNsl7CQDBw.text: Upon entry I was delighted with what I had saw in front of me. Once you walk in you will notice a HUGE glass case of the ENTIRE MENU. (Actual sizes of the dishes)  *Some mini items aren't included but it's okay!*  The staff.. ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL. I can't even begin to desribe how "wanted" I felt.  Anyways at first their whole setup was a teeny bit confusing, you have to pick a tray and pick out your main dish, then you set it down at the ticket holder then you are given the option to go and pick up mini sides like Tempura, onigiri, takiyaki, etc! They give you a timer to let you know when your meal is finished!  Once they have completed your meal, you will hear a buzzer notifying you to receive your food.  Finish and pay and you are good to go!  Honestly let me tell you how spacious and nice the interior is!  Many, many tables! Along with a wall of Manga, and other things you can use!  I ordered the Miso garlic pork belly along with a mini chicken Katsu plate!  My sides included 2 Takiyaki and one onigiri! I highly recommend the Taiyaki! The breading was insanely soft and the you can definitely taste the red bean!  I'm so glad I found this place, I will return without a doubt!

_JtACIeOR3V-57iBIbWkYQ.text: It's been awhile since I went here. I took a new friend here to show him around. He's loving it so far. Not the strip or downtown have to do with Vegas spring valley is good as well

mQZG8upIqr7m6nfc9nZJHw.text: CALPICO FOUNTAIN. That's it, that's the review. Jokes aside, I love Cafe Sanuki! The versatility of udon noodles really shows in the menu options here. My favorite dish was the seafood udon with tomato sauce, very savory and satisfying. The cafeteria style is unique and there's tons of seating! Big thumbs up, we love coming here for a delicious noodle dish.

yawsK8tQiTmaZjyvsK0v-Q.text: I'm so glad I found this joint! My friends have been dying for some noodles and I gave 3 options. Either we stick to the same old ramen joint we been going to, try out a new ramen joint, or savor in on some Udon! Being that my friends and I are from Hawaii, I heard Cafe Sanuki brought the idea of bringing back Marukame Udon from Hawaii but in their own style. We were awed by their gigantic display of all their specialties preserved behind glass. - this gives good visual on how big their dishes are and to bring out the watery mouths to try out everything. So that is what we practically did. The ordering line was very simple; grab a tray, look at the digital menu if you haven't looked at the paper menu, and then choose to your liking. Sanuki is a Japanese traditional restaurant and provide their hospitality as they would back east. Always open to offer assistance for those who have a hard time deciding what to order. We had no problem with ordering everything they had! I love to mention that they also have packaged flavored onigiri you can grab off the shelf for cheap, not to mention additional toppings for your bowls and tempura appetizers.   If you check into yelp, you get a free beverage! Try their Calpico yogurt drinks with flavored pumps!! Forget their soda dispensers and yolo!! Don't forget to also use their Exclusive coupon to get 10% off on your order!!

w2CwsVTqtvNsBPgigvPlaQ.text: Friendly staff, great food, made fresh, and quickly! I thoroughly enjoyed item 24, the curry, rice and fried chicken. This place is definitely worth checking out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The staff was very friendly, prices were reasonable, the food was delicious and also came our very quickly!

kNvE73VLcxEve-UfYl9i9Q.text: I saw the good review on Yelp and visited this restaurant today. I am from Japan, and I can vouch for you that their Udon is authentic. My husband and I tried Yaki Udon (stir fried) and Nabeyaki Udon (Udon with broth in a special serving pot). They were both good with large serving size. Yaki Udon was 7.45 and Nabeyakin Udon was 9.45. They are both great value.  You pick your udon and side dishes and pay at the counter. They will give you a pager to beep you when your food is ready to pick up at the counter. Their system is pretty close to "Hanamaru Udon" chain in Japan which is my favorite.  I am a Japanese and have been back to Japan many times in recent years. Their Japanese style udon is authentic. I am not quite sure about Cabonara or Tomato sauce udon, but may be I will be brave and try next time.   The restaurant is spacious and clean with great service (although it's self-serve, the workers were attentive and offered to clean up our table).  I will go back there again. I found my little Japanese spot in Las Vegas!

The facility was very clean, the staff is friendly and accommodating and the food was cooked fresh and the flavors were just right! I'm glad to see Sanuki make changes to make the dining experience more pleasurable. We'll sure be coming back more often.

mvOlOkOwi7i91UZObfvSHA.text: This place was so great! I liked that you could pretty much customize your food. Your udon can be simple or really extra, it's totally up to you! So how it works, start with your udon and then you can add things like tempura, chicken karrage, or hand rolls. You can add as many or as few at you like! Are you more of a visual person and now sure what to get? That's ok! Because right when you walk in, you are greeted with a beautiful cased display of what they have to offer.   I ordered the #2 and added shrimp tempura, some veggies tempura and a tuna mayo hand roll. It was all really good! Definitely no complaints!   One thing that I really like about this place was their customer service! Their AC was down so it was pretty hot in there. So to accommodate everyone, they offered everyone a free drink and a couple for 50% off their next visit. How awesome is that?

-zoat2FNLgt4Ofur8q13xw.text: Food and service was exceptional. The place was hopping. Very popular and everyone seemed happy with their food. My family loved their meals. And even when one person didn't care for theirs they took care of us. They have a no questions asked policy.

5UJMBAFYfiNAGkUfATXZOQ.text: This is a cool little place that has a quick and easy process of ordering food. They use the cafeteria concept where you order your main dish then grab any additional items as you head to the register.   I ordered the curry base and it was pretty good. The noodles where consistent and chewy, and the curry was just right. I would definitely come back to try their other soup base.

F4QpOSv-w3gIl-fFyALNNg.text: Good addition and competition for udon monzo. I do like udon monzo better- better flavors.  The curry dish are great.  Tempura is good. Service is great and helpful.  Love the food display when you enter for people who loves pictures of what they are getting.  Lemonade is great.  Glad to have onigri in town.  Must try.

3vjmo9Nvk3z_y9OZGxcnBg.text: Service was excellent here but the food is fairly light in flavor so if that's your kind of thing then this is a great spot.   The daikon in the oden was bitter and the broth itself is extremely mild. Nothing took on the broth flavor whatsoever. Then again I did show up at opening since I had lots of plans made, but why put it out then?  I'd just go for the noodles and the tempura. Very average though. An alright price but quality could improve here and there.

q15EpsbWXk4yjBLVsgNVeg.text: I just lost my ass on video poker.  Got a Lyft back to the condo to lick my wounds and shower off some bad luck and some secondhand smoke.  I wanted good Japanese but after the beating I took Momofuku was out tonight.  I eyed this spot on Yelp.  Hmmm.  Good rating.  Close by.  And Cheap.  Perfect.   Nabeyaki udon - big hot metal bowl.  Good flavor.  Two of my favorite foods on top: shrimp tempura and an egg.  The egg was barely poached and runny just like it's supposed to be.  Got an extra tempura shrimp and pumpkin from the self serv plus a nigiri to go.    Facility - big, clean, lots of chairs and tables.  Lit well.    Almost makes me want to lose again.

rugjBPGxovVHzApA8ptK3g.text: This is a decent place to get a variety of udon (hot or cold), temperas, pork baos, and other finger foods.  I had the nabayaki udon and my husband had the spicy one and we both ordered one pork bao each.  Nabayaki udon was delicious with large portion for one.  The pork baos were okay.  They were decent, however I compare every bao to Momofuku's pork baos and it doesn't compare, however it has its own merits.  Would I be stopping here again?  Possibly for a quick bite with my family if I'm in the mood for some udon.

_VXsj4npulhtRi6MYxSIBA.text: If you get anything here, make sure it's the FREE LEMONADE (with Yelp check-in). The udon is good too lol.   My friends, who are locals in Vegas, recommended Cafe Sanuki for dinner on a Sunday night. It was nice and empty when we arrived at about 8pm. The restaurant is cafeteria style, so it took a while to figure out what to order and to feel comfortable enough to get in line and place our orders.   One of the workers kindly came over and asked if we had been there before and instructed us to grab a tray, make our selection at the counter, and continue on to pick any tempura or hand rolls to add to our order. I ordered the carbonara udon with a mini order of katsu curry to share with my boyfriend. I was given a pager which beeped even before I had reached my table, and an employee brought my bowl over to me and put it on my tray. The udon was more like an alfredo than a carbonara, but delicious nonetheless. I took about a third of my meal to-go.  During our visit, I probably drank about 3 cups of their special lemonade, which we thought was a combination of lemonade and Calpico. I'm still dreaming of the beverage to this day. Make sure to refill your cup before you leave so you can enjoy it on your way home or even the day after!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara udon

i2r6W2RdqaCHVcZdXvtZ_A.text: We flew in to Vegas and had a six hour layover. We were very hungry, so after checking our luggage in, we searched for a Japanese restaurant that was both close to the airport and inexpensive. We yelped for a while and we found this restaurant! And I'm sure glad we did.   When you first enter the restaurant, you're greeted with a nice display case filled with vibrant-colored appetizing-looking food models and prices. The food service is also incredibly fast. It's cafeteria style so you grab a tray and order what you want. In this case ontama udon and miso garlic pork belly ($7.95 each). Then as you go down the line, there's various tempura and rice rolls varying in prices. For example a single shrimp tempura was about $1.25. Our total was about $25 and the portions were filling. Also if you're a first time visitor, they'll give you complimentary soup to wash everything down. The food was delicious and for the price you pay, you can't beat that. The customer service was fun and friendly.   If you have time to kill and looking for a nearby Japanese restaurant (from the airport) that serves quality food for an inexpensive price, then I highly recommend Cafe Sanuki

jKZsLUKxYf3K1k2u7EMC7A.text: This is a great Japanese restaurant that makes me feel like I'm in japan! I've only been here once so far, but I'll be back again to try the other dishes. I ordered the yakisoba noodles which came in a huge bowl that's larger than my face (see picture)! They have a large variety of noodle dishes to choose from. When you enter the store, they have a display of all the different entrees you can order.  I was very excited to see that they have self-serve calpico, which means you can get unlimited re-fills. It was one of my favorite drinks when I was living in japan over the summer. My friend got the lemonade and also recommends that too!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The yakisoba portion is huge!

h4kR1GBHUsf1ZDOJQRhxjg.text: Cafeteria-style concept udon noodles. The ordering is a little cumbersome in my opinion since the food isn't readily made and sometimes you have to wait at the pick-up section for a while which holds up the line. You get a free drink if you check-in on Yelp so I got some Calpico which was super good. They also have in-house lemonade which is delicious.  I ordered the kitsune udon which is very reasonably priced (~$6) and added a mini rice bowl + some shrimp tempura. It was A LOT of food. The noodles were perfectly tender and the tempura was light and crispy.  It's a good place to get some cheap udon and we'll definitely be back

I was a little confused at first when I walked in cause you go to the right and order and for some reason I thought you sat down and ordered but it was kinda cool to order and grab your tempura and gyoza and what not yourself before you sit. I had the tantan (can't remember if that's how it was spelled) and my boyfriend got the miso pork belly bowl and the #3 udon and they were all great. So full I may explode.  For some reason it didn't give us the option to tip when we paid and we didn't have cash so I'm hoping that gets fixed cause we felt bad. Will definitely be back

25WE0OJ4Bk2vpX_ZpKFkAg.text: Cafe Sanuki is a great new udon spot to compete with the recent wave of udon openings in the area. This place takes udon and throws a Chipotle-style customize-your-own bowl spin to it. On top of that, the most basic styles are an affordable $5-6. You can then add toppings and side dishes such as onigiri and various tempura to your bowl for $1.75ish.   I tried the curry beef udon with a large skewer of chicken tempura (three big pieces) and fish cake tempura. The curry was flavorful and had lots of pieces of beef. I was surprised by how well-cooked the udon noodles were. The small bowl of miso garlic pork belly on top of rice was also quite flavorful and crispy. It would've been nicer if the slices of pork belly weren't so thin. Everything came very fast and efficiently - the Japanese way. However, some udon bowls that my friends ordered did take longer to make. The beverage station has a number of different drinks including Calpico, lemonade, and a Coca-Cola Freestyle machine.   The one downside was that many of the pieces of tempura became very soggy. I enjoyed my piece of fish cake tempura as it had just come out of the frier, but everything else including the onion blossom and the chicken had that soggy texture that oozed with leftover oil as you bit into it. Still a great deal overall, especially if you can time it to get the tempura fresh.

2zgTrJUAgRHco5J4pbbilA.text: Nothing sounded better than heading home from Vegas and grabbing a big bowl of udon.  The restaurant is pretty clean and well kept upon walking in. There's plenty of spaces for all party sizes and the first thing you'll want to do is check out their glass wall of menu samples. After you're done drooling, you'll want to walk to the right where you'll grab a tray to order your entree, grab some tempura, and then pay. After paying, its seat yourself so go ahead and grab a table!  The service here is absolutely wonderful! The front cashier was exceptional and very upbeat. She helped clear our tables and just made it a really good first experience even though they're not a service restaurant.   I tried the:  Seafood Udon - very tasty. Light tomato and cream flavor with shrimp, fish, and scallop.  Tan Tan Udon - spicy broth with minced meat. Loved the flavor of this!   Note: don't forget to check in for a free drink!

59_604E1al9lZoqMY7N4xQ.text: The restaurant looks very simple and elegant. Love the layout! I ordered the Kake Udon, which was great for a windy day (like today). Glad I looked on yelp to find out about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kake Udon

PDOYki_UwnN9-dQrdKaT0Q.text: When I first heard about this place was through a group of friends. My initial response was, "Snooki from MTV Jersey Shore opened up a restaurant." However, I quickly learned it was pronounced Cafe Sa-Nu-Ki, Lol. Its a Japanese restaurant with emphasis on Udon.  The ambience reminds me of Shirokiya Japanese Village at Ala Moana Shopping Center in Hawaii. Its a large food hall/beer garden with tons of Japanese food vendors. Especially the fake plastic display case in front, which is common at Japanese restaurants.   Cafe Sanuki set up is a cafetaria style, where you place an order from a numbering system then your order is prepared fresh in front of you. There is side dishes like Tempura, Onigiri(Rice balls) that you can add on. There are other items that require a wait time. For those items, your given a pager and the staff will call you once its ready at the cash wrap/pick up station.   The food is really good and very authentic to what you expect from Japanese Udon. I personally enjoy the Kamatama and Kitsune Udon and the Yaki Udon. Portions is quite filing, considering Udon is more thick than ramen. Another cool feature is that they have rice bowls in regular and mini sizes, great for sharing or if your feeling really hungry.  A few times, we had the pleasure of meeting with the owner, Henry Fan. Nice guy who is compassionate with his restaurant. He made sure our visits were good and everything was up to our satisfaction. Overall, a great place to have a meal with friends and family in a cool setting.  2018 Yelp Review #8

nRKJLEYrIalbfGqUkissyw.text: If you're in the mood for some Japanese udon, Cafe Sanuki is a great choice to feed my cravings.  --- Carbonara Udon - 5/5 Stars - if you know someone who is a picky eater and has had pasta from a generic Italian restaurant, this is the perfect choice! It has a familiar taste with the Italian cream sauce but with noodles that are bigger. Niku Beef Udon - 4/5 Stars - the Sanuki broth with the seasoned beef and onions warms you up on those cold fall/winter nights. I added a poached egg, 2 shrimp tempuras, squid tempura, and a fish cake tempura to my bowl. Everything tasted fine except the beef. For some reason, the beef had a weird taste to it. But the one thing I did like about the beef was how tender it was! It was incredibly soft and wasn't hard to chew.  --- Overall - 5/5 Stars - I love coming here and trying something new each time. I recommend this to a lot of my friends and it never disappoints. There's plenty of seating and the ambiance makes you feel like you're in Japan! The refillable Calpico drink is the cherry on top here. Calpico bottles can range from $2 to $3 and getting a refillable Calpico here is a steal!

1xI9zXwk3deu0pOtsoHfOQ.text: The vibe of this place make me feel like I'm in Japan!! Reminds me of Tokyo food court! I love the concept and the atmosphere but I wish the food taste better!!   For its taste, it would be more acceptable if the price point is 30%lower   I had clams udon and the broth taste like it made out of packaged ramen, water down. The tempura batter is on the lower quality but you can get a piece of shrimp tempura for $1.65  If you're looking for good udon, I wouldn't recommend this place. There's a specialty udon place down the street with higher prices point but worth every penny.   This restaurant sits in a huge shared parking lot so you wouldn't have problem with parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1cqoNkk9C4xCIU1UfGI8Og.text: Cafe Sanuki knows how to perfect each dish. I sampled their assorted tempura, spam musubi, mentai cream noodle, katsu curry, and special brewed lemonade. Almost made it feel like I was vacationing in Japan again! Looking forward to the next time we visit Vegas!

z8no_4DJQZkMl1Imr05Ccw.text: Really enjoyed dining here. They have so many options to choose from and everything was delicious. The fried tempura and single side items are kind of pricey but the noodles and dishes are decent price. I like their drink options to add flavoring and their drinks were great as well. Lots of seatings available. We ordered quite a bit and was full. I loved everything.

7MAraPkz_X9cnIhTWkqftg.text: Should've posted this last week sorry:  My boyfriend, daughter, and I LOVE this place. From the food to the workers/service. It's always so good!! We've been seriously a fan since soft opening.  Sometimes I get the kake udon. But last night I got the mentaiko udon. It was so delicious.  My boyfriend got the seafood udon, which also was so good! Both reminded me of a Japanese pasta.  We always get the onigiri. The Japanese girl told me they make it fresh everyday! We also got to try the strawberry red bean dessert also made by a sweet Japanese lady that works there. It was not too sweet and it just hit the spot!!  This place is the best for that soup/ noodle craving! Not too heavy and the taste will make it so satisfying! Thank you cafe sanuki!

Ne_QVRsyksz8fdyvtdodRQ.text: Very friendly and welcoming. Love their calpico soda fountain. And enjoyed the seafood tomato pasta and their spam triangle roll very convenient to just eat right away or take out right away.

Pr0HeWHssmt-8F-xov2ptg.text: I really wanted to give this higher marks but was disappointed with the udon. Let's start with the good. Service was excellent. People were friendly and accommodating. Parking was plentiful and restaurant was clean and large enough to fit a football team. I got the nabeyaki udon. The dashi was on point with great body and a hint of sweetness! The tempura was light and crispy and great as well! Now for the bad. The udon noodles themselves were mushy. I even asked them to please make another bowl and to have the noodles chewy but the result was the same. The staff was very friendly in getting me to try a second bowl. I've been to the restaurant that Mr Fan first went to in Waikiki and the noodles there and also Jumbo and Iyo were both firm and chewy. I haven't been to the Sanuki region of Japan so maybe its supposed to be mushy?? In either case I would have definitely given a 5 star rating if the noodles (which should be the star of the show) weren't mushy. Everything else was great!!

QZSzFz-A3OdDcoM2_1Oc8w.text: It all started with the order. I went up to the counter to order and was interrupted by the teenage cook who wanted to finish his conversation with the other teenage cook about sports. I had to wait til he was done.  15 mins after placing the order we went to ask why it was taking so long.  It's was our first time here and a big group came in after us and they ALL got their food.  So I went up to ask about our order and come to find out it was never placed even though I had already paid for it.  Less than five mins our food comes with a ton of rice and less meat. Wasn't what I expected considering the previous reviews. I really wanted to like this place but the service was bad.

The portion size was very large and was served hot. I also got 3 pieces of tempura: zucchini and shrimp. Although they were good, they sat out for a while so they weren't as warm and they were a little soggy. You can also get a drink for free by checking in so why not? You can get a soda from the fancy coke machine where you can concoct any soda.

6ikZBNb6s4IXeebrFJ-OIA.text: The Cafe was really nice although it was a little different because I didn't expect the cafeteria style ordering system. I liked the interior and design of the place, which was cool. The udon there is really good and traditional. I really like the texture of it. It's chewy and perfectly cooked. I also ordered the curry katsu, which I thought was chicken but it was pork, and it also was delicious. The curry was a little watery but it tasted pretty good. The employees are nice and as I was going up to clean my tray, one of them came up and did it for me. The customer service and food is really good so I definitely would come back.

NW5fG9ec4sq8ozIpsddvAg.text: This was about my fifth time coming to Cafe Sanuki and this time I was disappointed. The food is still very good but the business seems overwhelmed by it's success. The wait online was excessive and the wait for the food to be prepared was too long. Staff was too busy to answer questions. But worst of all the drink dispensers were all empty and the condiments were all depleted and staff paid no attention to it. For a cafeteria type restaurant this was very bad.

GZNE4pyEsi5iguU9OO5zaA.text: I came in on a day when their AC was down, but I still had a great time. I really appreciate the staff for being friendly and very nice. The food was seriously fresh and the portion is generous. I enjoyed the mood of the cafe; they had all these small japanese decors and mangas and books on japan and everything is nicely set up. Reallyyyyyy neat place, I'd recommend this to anyone that's into tempura and udon, and I'd definitely be back for more.

They have a Coke freestyle machine, as well as calpico and lemonade mixed daily. Belongs on every top 10 restaurants list in Vegas for sure.

OxCn-0e4OrWllPJ1sTsaaQ.text: I'm torn, I love the staff, free drink with Yelp check-in  and atmosphere but we came for Curry, and the Curry didn't come for us  We've been on a Curry streak around the city. We came here looking for udon Curry since udon is Sanuki's thing. This is what we got: Curry that was more soup like, and had a fishy taste to it. We are more used to thick Japanese Curry. The upside was that you could see what was in the Curry, like veggies and sliced beef. The bao was good and the side of tempura squid was succulent but cold. Prices are great. You've been informed, good luck!

e4BuN_wmcExBuqTX9rMytg.text: Amazing place udon is well priced and copious general amounts. Come back here everyday

Py7BkVikgDkaOyJf8L6diw.text: Finally we are back here with the family everything from food just got better in our opinion compared to our first visit but staff some change. Tonight we came across the first who takes our food order his name is Richard we are glad to met someone like him who are pleasant, very helpful and most importantly knowledgeable of the foods we are asking questions about. Richard even goes above and offered me the curry because I was hesitance of ordering it again from my first experiences but he let me try it and I must say they improve the texture and taste of their curry. So tonight we ordered Seafood Tomato Cream, Yaki Udon and Katy's Curry Rice with some tempuras on the side (Shrimp, Fish cake & Chicken) EVERYTHING WAS GOOD! But most importantly the service we received from Richard was make this dinner memorable, next time we come back we are looking forward to explore other items on their menu. Thanks Richard if you reading this for the AWESOME guest services!!!

8pBylj-deTbhasZ0X2bXmw.text: Unfortunately, for all the food is pretty good, the service is terrible. We've given this a good couple tries now and don't think we will be coming back. Our food order is incorrect more often than not, they advertise some food that I have yet to see available, and despite closing in the middle of the day to clean and restock ... they seem to use an awful lot of pre-packaged vegetables, can't quite keep things in stock, and don't appear to have the time to train employees on ingredients to answer questions when asked or, especially after our last experience just tonight, on customer service either.   A lot of people seem to love it here, and regretfully ... I cannot figure out why.

SLryuqelmpHP1kk7kqA4og.text: Been wanting to check this place out and finally did! My friend was raving about this one udon place in Hawaii so I decided to have lunch with them here, & she said it's very similar to it.  Style of ordering: it's like a cafeteria style. Basically, it's not your norm sit and take order type of noodle place. You pick what you want, you go in line, you pay.. then you find a table.  I think it's such a cool concept and I love the fact that they make the noodles fresh AND in front of you! :) I got the miso pork rice bowl (wasn't very impress, I'd give it a 6/10) and my friends got the hot soup noodles. The ones they got are great and the broth are super yummy! After getting your main course, you also get the pick your side dishes and even this red bean dessert. The tempura and rice cakes are bombbbbb! The red bean dessert..not so much :( it was a little stale and tasted like it's been sitting out for a long time.  Over all, the whole experience was awesome. Make sure to check in for your free drink ;) get some of their signature lemonade and add some flavor to it. I did mango lemonade, cause .. ITS MANGO! Lol who doesn't love mango flavored anything. The staff were nice and super helpful

ZPpz57ZyPBB0pCgr4M4X9g.text: The ambiance is astounding here and feels like grabbing an excellent home cooked meal from somebody's Japanese grandmother. So comfy, you grab your tray and just sit down with a big bowl of warmth. The food practically embraces you with a hug of the soul. I grabbed the seafood udon in a creamy tomato based sauce, my palate was coated with umami and I accompanied it with a small pork belly rice bowl. Got the free drink with a yelp check in and the drink selection, my goodness the drink selection. They have the calico yogurt drinks on tap, you know the little mini yogurt drink that you suck down 5 at a time? Yeah, you can have that as a drink. And their lemonade, so addicting, not too sweet, mellow creaminess, I drank 2 full cups of the stuff and it wasn't overbearing.I'm not a soda kind of guy so I'm happy they had other things, but if soda is your thing they have the awesome 140+ flavors coke machines so go mix and a matching. Anyways, definitely a new favorite spot, can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is awesome.
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Braised Pork Belly bowl.
Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Display of the assortment of food.

gKNJlo2nLdXhziEa6buk5A.text: If you are a fan of udon noodles or want to try udon for the first time, do yourself a favor and visit a proper udon house rather than have udon from a sushi restaurant. Sanuki makes their noodles in-house so the flavor and texture will be superior to anywhere else that doesn't make it fresh.  Niku (beef) udon: Traditional udon broth with beef and onions on top. The broth is flavorful without being too salty. The beef was thinly sliced and was a little more fatty than I prefer but still not bad.   Seafood tomato udon: A modern twist on udon, definitely my favorite between the two bowls I ordered. The udon comes in a tomato cream sauce rather than broth. The seafood was perfectly cooked. The sauce is light and pleasing without being overly acidic. Imagine a great seafood tomato-based pasta dish and replace the pasta with fresh udon noodles.   Extras: Soft boiled egg tempura: I enjoyed having this with the niku udon. The yolk was not too runny and the tempura batter was crunchy without being salty. Fish cake tempura: I like fish cake and I enjoyed the texture difference of a soft fish cake center with a crunchy tempura shell.   Lemonade: Love the flavor but beware this lemonade has dairy in it. I'm lactose-intolerant and didn't know it had dairy until I asked.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #11 Seafood tomato cream udon

Photo of Cafe Sanuki - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a pleasant surprise to find an udon house in Las Vegas. They make udon fresh in-house, which is the only way to have good udon.

_reiI89mYPGjZT2i99dQUg.text: The udon was delicious the choices were ample. The tempura selection was decent, the only problem was the cafe didn't anticipate the Christmas Day lunch crowd therefore they were running out of tempura and the wait was long.

g3hLXAYuouKZfko3Z3RYnA.text: Might be best to stick with the noodles here. The carbonara was rich and flavorful, enjoyed by all. Big thumbs up for the pork belly bao bun. Friendly service.  Disappointed in the rice dishes mainly because the rice itself was soggy. When the abundant juice from the meat toppings is added, then the bowl turns rather soupy and unappealing. Strongly suggest to reconsider the rice cooking process or switch to a drier rice variety.

O3r4ZemChCbb5AbeuTPlsA.text: I love the concept of Cafe Sanuki.  Honestly, it was not what I expected because I didn't read too many reviews on Yelp before walking in the restaurant.  I saw a few pictures and was immediately SOLD to come try them out lol.  I was actually imagining a small hole in the wall full service restaurant.  So instead, the restaurant was bright, clean, with happy and friendly staff.  It's like a futuristic cafeteria you'd see in sci fi movies.  We tried an udon bowl (it was huge), a curry bowl, a beef over rice bowl, and a pork belly bao.  Everything tasted good.  For the price point, the nice staff, the large and clean dining area, and pretty tasty food, I am definitely a fan.
